Hello,I was confused while buying new earphones and choosing between 1more Piston  & Sennheiser CX 180. But after continuos research of 3-4 days I decide to go with CX 180.When this product arrived, I first checked for the Originality of it. Thanks to Amazon Service, I found that Product was Original.Pros:-Balanced Sound Quality.-Light Weight Plugs.-Matte Finish helps the earphone look fresh and new for a long time.-This is not an angled earphone, so if you are a person like me who often breaks earphones. Do not worry, this comes out very easily with little force, so whenever you are likely to break this earphone by mistake, this earphones will come out and save you some money.cons:- Tangles.Thank You.

I usually don't write reviews, but I've bought two of these and haven't been disappointed.The sound quality is good, but for me, the best feature no one seems to talk about is the mic. I take a lot of calls, and though this doesn't have noise cancellation, it works very well for making calls in noisy environments. I rarely get complaints that others are not able to hear me or of traffic noise disrupting calls (a perennial problem in India). I'm able to take conference calls when travelling, which is a huge plus. The build quality is good. There is a problem that the wire connecting the audio input is weak and tends to break if not stored carefully. I've had that problem once, but Sennheiser replaced this without question. I've started storing the pair in the pouch they supply and have not had issues later.The pouch really keeps things secure. A couple of days ago, I forgot to take it out of my shirt before putting it into the washing machine. I later realized this and picked it from the shirt pocket after the washing cycle, dried the pair and found that it worked as usual - a huge relief.I'm not a huge audiophile and don't wax eloquent on basss/treble reproduction and the like, but for me, this is a great pair for my use cases - good music playback, great service and ability to make calls on the street. I find very few reviews focussing on these, so wanted to highlight these for prospective buyers.

Very good balance in bass and treble. Reflecting true music.Another Best thing  about this earphone has its.. noise cancellation and soft ear buds and extra L- shaped 3.5 mm jack.Wire quality is sturdy.Call quality is also crystal clear.

I have kept my earphones safely eer since day. There‚Äôs no chance of any physical damage in the wiring.

tilte: Excellent product but cable quality could be better,
review_body: I have used wide ranges of earphones over years, some brands being Skullcandy (Smokin Buds 2), JBL (T 210), Sennheiser (HD 180, HD 210, CX 271, CX400 II Precision, CX 185 Street II, and now CX 275 S) Fiio (f1), Koss (Porta Pro) Audio Technica (ATHCOR150RD),First off there is a large difference between CX 185 Street II and CX 275 S don't even compare, CX 185 has too much of treble with very low bass, CX 275 S is very well balanced, CX 275 S reminds me of my CX 271 which I used for 7 years, its wire was of great quality and tangle free, I would have easily paid an extra 1k for that kind of cable,To anyone looking to buy earphones, go for Audio Technica>JBL if your budget is below 1k and Sennheiser CX 275 S if you just need the best audio output, and regarding other earphones I've used JBL has decent output, and regarding Fiio f1 it is just a piece of crap, it was an impulsive decision I made based just on the brand without any research, don't throw your money in garbage buying it, finally make sure you buy it from a well rated seller.

But the bass end is totally plain. If you are a bass lover this one is not for you. The high, mid and low freq are clean. If u can tweak the equaliser in your device then u can get some amount of bass. High and mid freq are the best from this. So in short a very good product, but not for basslovers.Regards

Firstly I would like to appreciate Amazon.in for its amazingly fast delivery. The product reached in less than 24hrs and I opted for regular delivery.Now about the Product.I have used or still use products like Audio Technica ATH-M50X , Beats Studio, Powerbeats 2 , Jaybird X2 , Panasonic Extra Bass , Bose SoundTrue, Mi Piston3, etc .These Sennheiser earphones are firstly extremely comfortable and lightweight. They have a very loud sound output. The bass is 4/5, Treble is 4/5. The sound quality is rich and it doesn't feels like a sub 2k earphone. The earbuds are small and therefore allow a comfort fit while listening lying down or sleeping and they do not poke or irritate while listening for long hours.I purchased it for Rs 1600/- , it comes with a leather case and a L - Shaped converter which is very thoughtful .Overall i would highly recommend.

Though this particular item didn't have a built-in microphone, the price was reasonable enough that I decided to purchase it. Initially, I found the tiny pinch holds on the eaebuds difficult to let them be inserted easily and quickly into ears. But with some practice that problem has receded. And, no complaints on sound quality. Overall, it does the job well enough.

that clearly say that company have very supportive staff and warranty claiming is very instant (the reason behind i buy it because I want good service after sales)***De-merits***No good noice cancellationNo micThe length of wire is bit largeCompany not give any case or pounch for store it, so it is little erritating to store it.***My opinion***In this price range this is best option for fake or original***I seen too many video about this earphone on YouTubeThat say,Fake have only senheixer logo on joint both sideOriginal have one side senheixer logo and other side have "cx 180"Easiest way to check genuine product is below:-Company give one unique code in side of packaging by this code you can go company website and fill the code and website tell you product is fake or tilte: Sennheiser disappointed with the product but delighted with the after sales support!
review_body: I would have given 2 stars to the product has it not been for Sennheiser's after sales support.The product build quality is not great and it developed wrinkles at multiple place with normal usage. The wire length got reduced drastically after the wire twisted from several places. Even the music was not extraordinary but it was definitely decent.However, the mic and earphones were good if you compare it to other brands, just that it did not meet the high expectations one normally associates with Sennheiser. One of the earpieces stopped working 5 months after purchase. But a big THANKS to the best after sales support of Sennheiser, the product was replaced in 5 minutes with no questions asked!Kudos to Sennheiser to have such a customer friendly attitude and have such warranty policies which are actually there to help customers and not bog them down with questions and procedures.I will buy Sennheiser again despite this product being average given its cost because I am not afraid that my product might be faulty or develop a fault.Verdict - Buy this product for the decent sound with a great mic and the promise of Sennheiser. Audiophiles can look for other options!

tilte: Great sounding earphones with one shortcoming
review_body: Let me get this straight, the sound from these is amazing. The highs and mids are clear and the low bass end is great. Recommended for bass heads. Fit is comfortable and they don't fall off from the ears.Now the shortcoming, these earphones are not durable. The wire is very thin as compared to other earphones. In the unit I received, sound from the right ear piece had reduced to half after only 3 months of use. But as Sennheiser gives 2 years of warranty, they replaced the earphones without asking any questions. Right now using the replacement ones and they've been working great.

tilte: best sound quality,great at noise cancellation
review_body: I have been using these headphones for over a year now and there is zero complain on it. the bass of the sound is perfect even the 4D sounds are really cool you can hear them really well. The product comes with three ear buds in different sizes so you can select the one which fits your ear properly. the noise cancellation it is awesome once plugged into your ears it cancels out the sound from out completely and it detangles easily, has a long wire, the microphones are good to communicate hence one could not ask better from earphones.

This is one of the best product at this price point. The sound quality is just amazing. Loved it. Treble is on point. Bass is powerful. Mids are balanced. Overall a joy to hear music in these earphones.Build quality is also very good. Using for around 6 months. No problem whatsoever.I would strongly recommend senheiser over other manufacturers.

tilte: Extremely overrated product with low-fi sound
review_body: Coming from a Sony mdr ex150 to this one. These are 6dB louder than the sonys. But while listening, it feels like I am listening to 96kbps mp3s. There is also a certain graininess (must be some distortion) in voices that is totally absent from the Sony.Headphone emphasizes tones around 100Hz and 4kHz. But at the cost of real treble, lower mids and subbass. Unlike Sony, bass here is about quantity and not quality. It is loose, distorted and does not go as low. Granted, all cheap earphones cut sharply above 15kHz, but I was expecting some sparkle in 6-10kHz range; even that is missing here, making the sound signature extremely lo-fi.Comfort is much inferior to Sony and Panasonic ones due to large diameter drivers used in this product. If only they were any good apart from increased sensitivity! Stay away unless you are middle aged/old person with age related hearing loss.

Sennheiser are known for their great studio grade sound quality with a flat EQ, and this pair is no different. I really love the sound quality of these headphones, it is full with equal emphasis on the lows, mids and highs without any artificial bass boosting. You get a flat sound which makes this pair really versatile. It is great for movie watching and voice calls. The mic is great. Everyone I called using this pair said I sounded clear with no distortions. Also these come with 2 years warranty which is very nice to have.Now let's get to the cons, and as usual its the built quality. The wires are thin and made up of flimsy looking rubber. I have seen braided cables in headphones much cheaper than this. I would have loved Sennheiser to at least give some quality materials, because you have to really take care or else I feel the wires will break. Also the mic button feels cheap.Overall, this is a great pair of headphones for anyone looking for rich and clear sound. If you like bass, something from Sony would be better for you.

tilte: Quality Headphone at a reasonable price
review_body: This is the second time I am purchasing this product. To be frank I am happy with the quality of this headphone, obviously brand itself hails it's fame. The L joint for the connection with phone jack is supreme as this design reduces the risk of wire breaking at joint. The only drawback that can be highlighted is this earphone does not come with a build-in mic. While making calls it becomes difficult for the receiver to hear us properly. If you are looking for a good quality earphone with mic you can consider using http://amzn.in/d/8AcMnWn of the same make. For those who enjoy music over phone calls go for this earphone. :}

This is my second set of Sennheiser earphones.My previous set lasted for 4 years that too was working fine till date .The only issue i faced before buying a new one was that the cable tore near the headphone jack which resulted in disconnection of audio at intervals while using it.PROS---* It comes with an international warranty of 2-years.* A good quality Storage pouch with Sennheiser logo over it is also there in the package to keep them safe while not in use.* Package contains 3 different size ear adaptors to fit your ear canal for superior sound.This is the best feature i loved about these earphones. The earplugs doesn't drop even if you sleep on with them .* Moreover your ear drums doesn't pain if you even put them on for longer duration .* It works fine with most of the smartphones without any compatibility issues .* These are the best headphones i have ever used till date in terms of audio performance ,speaker system and bass .I am set for another 4 years or maybe more and would love to buy them again n again.CONS---* The only issue is with the wire ,its too delicate . If it has a solid wire on the outer side the earphones will last for few more years before you feel the need to buy new ones.* I feel them a bit pricey. If you can get them in a deal for around Rs 1000 that would be the best suitable price for them.

They were my goto headphones in 2016 and worked perfectly till 2017 when someone stole them in my office. If I talk about the sound, its not very bassy since they are made to suit the masses however it's not like it lacks bass altogether. Quality of the cable is awesome and they are not easily breakable too. Have upgraded from these now but I would surely love to pick another pair of these as standby at any given point of time.

tilte: Daddy of clarity with noise cancellation
review_body: Its canal-ear design cancels every single noise in any public place in India you can be disturbed with. I use it with 40% volume level and sat right beside the driver of a govt. non-AC typical noisy Indian bus and couldn't even hear the honking of my own bus.Sound quality is very good. To say it short, it has much more better quality than its contemporaries. Its bass is so clear and smooth that doesn't hurt your ear at the same time you enjoy the best of 320kbps mp3 file.

Best earphones in the market.Only problem is they sound shrill at times.Their treble is a bit high.So might sound harsh at times.But unfortunately there are no better sounding earphones available in the market.Compared them to House of marleys,piston fit,Jblt110 & jbl c100si.They sound better.Ok let me tell you that they even sound better than sm e10c n rha's (i have both of them).Both of them have very low max volume,so you cant really enjoy your music.Buy e10c or rha if you want a earphone for your laptop.But if you want a earphone for your mobile and your budget is in the Rs500 + range then always buy cx180 eyes closed.Do not waste your money like i did.And if  your budget is below rs 500 then buy samsung ehs64 earphones (dont buy mi basics,sm es18 and boat 225,they all are inferior in sound to samsung ones)

Sennheiser CX225S has been on my list of earphones to try because of its earpiece design. I love that it's in-ear model and comes with a total of 3 earpieces; small medium and large. I use the small ones. They're very extremely weight and don't seem to weigh the earphones down while they're in use.The mic is pretty much what made me buy this. Quality of sound on call is very good and I majorly only use them for attending calls and watching videos on YouTube, Netflix and Amazon Prime. They work pretty well for the purpose.Cons:I use a Nokia 8 and these headphones give a constant buzzing noise in calls while the other person on call talks. The little connecter is even worse. Mutes my voice completely on the other side. Consider this if you use a Nokia phone.

CONS:I was a bit skeptical of buying the Sennheiser CX 275 due to the reactions on it's durability. I was correct on that part, the wires are too thin making the device vulnerable to wear and tear (and we are considering to buy a wire protector).PROS:Apart from that we have been blown away with the comfort while listening to media, it does not stress out your ears. Noise cancellation features are true to what they have claimed and the music streaming is the best( true to their reputation)All in all, I am satisfied with the purchase just that need to be a but careful with the product ( cannot be handled as how we really do with our usual earphones)

tilte: Depends on the ear who will listen...
review_body: This my 1st earphones from Sennheiser. I heard and followed the reviews. I thought it's really a good product with great sound quality. But as per my listening, I'm not satisfied.The sound is crisp with low bass. But I'm not a crisp listener. I like to listen balanced sound, nothing more nothing less. But crispness of this earphones are a bit high. After listening of some loud tracks, my ear hurts. It's not the way I listen sounds. So, I've to return it.If anyone likes to listen crisp sound, then go for it.

Sennheiser has always been a great company when it comes to sound products. This one is no exception.It's not really for bass heads, if that's what you're looking for. This will instead give you a well balanced, realistic sound. Noise cancellation is as good as the choice of earbud you put on. I generally do not care much about noise cancellation and will compromise on it for feeling non-claustrophobic, so I put the smallest earbuds on mine instead.Decent choice, and I got this at a rather affordable rate because of a sale. Only issue is the build quality, because the wires on this one are really quite flimsy and will know rather easily as well.The best part of buying Sennheiser though, is the customer service. You could honestly, basically break the thing, call Sennheiser service centre, go there, and they'll almost in no time give you a replacement product with no hassle.I've often broken my headphones twice and gotten them replaced without a cinch. It's the best reason really to buy a Sennheiser. They never skimp on customer service.

tilte: The build quality of the headphones are pretty nice. The wires look very thin and fragile ...
review_body: The build quality of the headphones are pretty nice. The wires look very thin and fragile though. Three types of earbuds were provided. The pouch given with the headphones are very useful for carrying the headphones around. Value for money.The jack could have been angled instead of being straight to avoid getting frayed. It hasn't frayed till now though. Very few headphones come with 2 years warranty in this range so that's a plus point.The listening experience is pretty decent. The bass is well balanced. Mic and mic button function very well. The mic works well when its held close to the mouth.

tilte: Has offers own pros and cons...
review_body: Pros:1) probably the best nice cancellation earphones at this price.2) you'll feel each and every nood seperately.3) great for those who don't like bass hevey garbages.4) Carrying punch is of good quality.5) The music will not be distributed when your earphones cable collide with your clothes or hands ( hope you're getting what I'm trying to say)Cons:1) Low bass ( bid still that's more than enough for me)2) Earphones are not tangle free.3) Thin cable, so requires extra care(so it's not for kids and idiots)

I wanted to buy jbl, then I read the users review and there was this one review posted by some describing the pros n cons of three different headsets among which senheiser cx180 stood out. Senheiser, a brand I ve hardly heard. Since the review was convincing, without another thought I placed an order for cx180 and truly it's worth. What a performance for an earphone, that too only INR 649/-. The best I ve had bought so far. I am recommending cx180 for anyone looking for an earphone under Rs.800/-. The only drawback I found was that it lacked a mic. May be it's too much to ask for at this price.

Bought these ~6 months ago. They've been great for ~4-5 months. Now the left one is barely working, and any volume higher than 50% produces extreme noise. But the time they did work (for ~4-5 months) they were great, very comfy (still are), had excellent sound, and base. Built quality is great too, I have tripped on them a few times (maybe that's why having problems now) yet the wire is still intact with no visible sign of wear and tear.

If you are looking for earphones that are really light weight,comfortable and bass heavy then look no further this is the perfect earphones that you can ever imagine.Pros:1. Excellent noise isolation cannot be compared any other brand for the price range.2. These earphones are bass heavy but they are also good in miss and lows.(If you are not into bass it is fine install an equiliser app for your phone and a little bit fidiling with the audio would give you better mids or highs)3. Best earphones that you can use while sleeping it doesn't hurt your ears.4. It has a 1.2 metre cble which is pretty long.5. They are really light in weight.6. Really long warranty.7. It has a L shaped Jack.( L shaped Jack's don't break even in rough use compared to normal jacks.)Cons:1. Lacks a microphones (If use it for calling it will use your phones mic)2. I don't think it is meant for rough use.(It looks very fragile and should be handled with care)3. They aren't tangle free.4. They tend to distrot at high levels of treble.(that is if you use an equiliser to increase the treble)I would recommend using the Larger pair of earbuds as they help in better noise isolation.Hope this review helps.

tilte: A newer addition in CX line of Sennheiser which is quite impressive yet not without its flaws.
review_body: This is a new Sennheiser in ear I've bought. I also have a CX-275 S and also CX-180. I've lost my CX-275 S while shifting of house so bought a CX-300 ii.These are quite impressive of a earphones from Sennhesier newest addition of CX family.ProsSound- Well when you buy earphones.. first you should do is put them in a burn in session. Burn in is like exercising of audio headsets. We do that so as to loose the diaphragm of headphone and to stress the headphone driver. We have to do at least 40 hours of burn in time for a headphone or earphone to achive its potential.  I've still gotta 30 hours worth of burn in but I've did a burn in of 6 hours as I've bought it since yesterday. Truth to be told.. when i heard it before burn in.. right out of package.. the sound is too trebly with sharp highs & no adequate bass whatsoever. After 6 hrs of burn in.. the earphones sound much cleaner, with pleasant mids & balanced highs & well enough thump of bass. Its as good as CX 180 i have but isn't as accurate in instrument seperation or sound stage as my CX 300 ii. So its a very well performed earphones for someone who prefers clarity.In earphone mic: Pretty good enough. No disturbance in hearing & recieving voices from my end & to the other person who's talking as well. It just does the job.ConsSound: i think the 6 hr burn in did do good.. but i can't help but listen that even at full volume.. the earphones isn't loud enough. Even less loud than CX-180 ii. Thats strange cause CX 180 costs less than this yet the loudness in CX-180 is superior even at 80% of volume.  I'll do more burn in of 30 hours to see if there'll be any change in loudness so that i can update this review again.Cable- The cable noise in this is too much than even in both CX-180 ii & CX- 300 ii of mine. This is particularly annoying when you're listening to your music while walking. Especially at calls too some of the voice gets muddled due to wind movement as well. The cable noise is a bit too much.So overall a good enough earphones which most music lovers can be pretty happy about than most of the generic sound signature brands. These are clear sounding & much more pronounced than others you can find if sound quality & clearness is paramount to you.Edit: After 30 hours of burn in.. yep this sound signature is more nuanced now. Much better with more rounded bass that kicks in when needed with more oomph. And also mids & highs are much more balanced & hits the right chord. Its just really good. And also loudness improved.Just go for itüëçüèª

Pros :1) Treble - 4/52) Bass - 3/5 (it's more treble derived earphone)3) Miss - 4/54) Sturdy with metal mesh as a driver mesh* Sound isn't too much amazing but at that price point don't expect too muchCons-1) wire quality is bit bad not easily ripping kind of stuff but still it's very delicateI would recommend anyone who wants a decent earphones for that price range and it's coming from a person who has used Bose Quite Comfort and other

Bought this cause of the brand name, and well, yeah it's actually not that great. Should be expected looking at the price. The only plus point is that songs don't sound terrible (which is a pretty low bar) and the earphones are quite light. But when it comes to sound quality, my god, where's the bass?! The songs sound so trebbily that music sounds better when I switch to basic headphones with even a little bit of bass. The brand is amazing, ONLY, if you can afford high-end accessories. If you're looking for a budget-friendly product that doesn't ruin the songs you like, look somewhere else. And before I leave, let me also slip in that there's no mic for calls. So the one purpose for which this thing was made, and that's a guess - music, it doesn't even do that right. I hardly paid anything, and I still feel ripped off. Sorry Sennheiser, I like you, but this ain't it.

tilte: Useless accessory inside. Wire very bad
review_body: Earphones r very good. But if you are having low budget, better go for oppo ofresh Earphones. They r having almost same sound with better bass and 10times better wire quality. Inside box u will get a leather pouch, a straight connector to L shaped connector dongle and earohone. Sennheiser is using ‚Çπ5 quality L shaped connector. With my first use its not working and making Google assistant pop up and is also decreasing the volume automatically. I replaced it with new one from AMAZON. But new one is also having same problem. I also tried with apple, mi, realme, samsung. Both connectors same issue. Wire of this earphone is so thin that it can be compared with thread. After 3 months of usage the wire will definitely break which will void the warranty. If ur budget is within ‚Çπ1k then stay away from it. Buy oppo o-fresh earphones. Believe me, u will feel sound difference of ~ 5% only between both. Bass is higher in oppo. This one has less bass.

tilte: Not durable. 3.5mm jack cane off on jerk.
review_body: First things first, this is not a noise cancellation earphone. It's rubber plugs keep outside sound from reaching the ear drums. These reproduce sound as close as possible to the source without modifying it. Although the wires look thin they are strong enough to bear daily tugs and snags, and won't break easily. No nonsense reliable earphones that are a reliable workhorse of ear phones.Edit 31 aug 2019 - the 3.5 mm pin breaks off the wire.  I was wrong about the durability. These phones are not durable for the price. I hasmd the Panasonic h 125 ergo earphones I purchased for half of the price and they were durable and of better found quality. I regret purchasing these. Go for other earphones for durability and smooth frequency response.

tilte: boAt 225 vs JBL CS100 vs Sennheisers cx180 | DETAILED Comparison after 1 YEAR of USE.
review_body: NOTE:@ There are thousands of reviews for this product, but surprisingly there's hardly any review explaining its performance in long run and comparing this earphones with similar ones available in market.@ I am using these earphones since last one year and in the meantime I also happen to use JBL C100SI and Sennhesiers CX180, so I would be comparing all these 3 earphones in this review.@ You get a " L " shaped connector in these earphones, so note that.I am dividing this review in several subtopics directly stating my user experience and stating which is the Best earphone in that subtopic,BUILT QUALITY :------------------‚óè boAt - Flat cables which is tangle free in true sense. Metal housing holds up good, but colour sheds off after 5-6 months. Perfect "L" shaped connector which is apt for using with laptops while resting.‚óè JBL - Small round cables, shredding off after 7-8 months of moderate usage. Plastic housing doing great so far.Connector is bent, but not in perfect "L" shape, so its quite pain to use while resting.‚óè Sennheiser - Small round cables, holding up good after 1 year of rough use. Plastic housing has become slick, as rubber coating on it has shredded off. Perfect "L" shaped connector which is apt for using with laptops while resting.‚óè‚óè WINNER- boAt 225 ‚óè‚óèCOMFORT :------------‚óè boAt - comfortable enough when used while in upright position. These are VERY UNCOMFORTABLE when you use them while resting on couch or bed for watching movies or so. Has very long earphone head.‚óè JBL - Comfortable enough in upright position. Slightly uncomfortable using while resting, as these have offset opening.‚óè Sennheisers - Comfortable in both the position. These are apt for long duration usage.‚óè‚óè WINNER - sennheisers cx180 ‚óè‚óèLOUDNESS :-------------CX180 > boAt 225 > JBL CS100SI‚óè boAt - tends to distort above 75% level of volume.‚óè JBL - Crystal clear even at full volume, but has least sound level in all of three.‚óè Sennheisers - tends to distort above 75% level of volume, but has greater sound level of all.‚óè‚óè WINNER - sennheisers cx180 ‚óè‚óèSOUND QUALITY ( Bass, mids & lows ) :---------------------------------------------I noticed that all of them have almost same Mids & lows, which are strong & Crisp. But bass levels are different.‚óè boAt - has average bass, I am very disappointed with it, since these earphones are marketed as bassheads.‚óè JBL - has least bass of all, I felt treble is high in these.‚óè Sennheisers - ton of bass and when used proper eartips, its just a treat for bass lovers.‚óè‚óè WINNER - sennheisers cx180 ‚óè‚óèSOUND QUALITY OVER CALL :----------------------------------‚óè boAt - I noticed in early few months, quality over call was great, but started to deplete after 5-6 months. But its still good, not as good as new. Noise cancellation is good and noticeable by person on other side.‚óè JBL - its quite average and has maintained the quality over a year now.‚óè Sennheisers - their NO microphone, lol :PNOTE: boAt & JBL both's mics works with android and iOS perfectly.‚óè‚óè WINNER - boAt 225 ‚óè‚óèCUSTOMER CARE :--------------------‚óè boAt : 1 Year warranty. Had no issues till date, so didn't got chance to check it. But some of my friends who ran into issue had mixed experiences.‚óè JBL : 1 Year warranty. Had issue with one ear piece and was replaced within 2 weeks after contacting nearest service center.‚óè Sennheisers : 2 Years warranty. I had 2 of these and one pair stopped working after a year and half, was replaced immediately within a week after contacting nearest service center.NOTE: I first contacted the company via mail with my product details and I was given all the required details for service. I would suggest this to all.‚óè‚óè WINNER : sennheiser cx180 ‚óè‚óèCONNECTIVITY :------------------All the earphones have 3.5mm connector and works perfectly with both android and iOS devices.VERDICT :----------I don't think I need to explain anything else now, since I mentioned all the points of all these earphones. To sum up, I would say boAt 225 are good, if you are going to use the mic alot and not going to use these earphones while resting on couch for watching movies. If you want mic and even want to watch movies resting, then go for JBL CS100SI. But if you want the earphones only for watching the movies and listening to songs like me, then certainly go for Sennheisers cx180.Hope this review helps you make sound decision.

tilte: The only option at this price point. Go buy it
review_body: Best possible/balanced sound at that price point, even better than Marshall EQmode which cost triple the price.No active noice cancellation, but noise is completely canceled out due to its shape and earbud which completely pack ears. You can't hear outside noice even when music is not playing.Worth buying, I am amazed that cx275s is a 2012 model and still a best sounding earphone and only option for people who really understand what real music is, beyond just thump and base.This earphone is exactly what I need.Thanks Sennheiser for providing such a beautiful sound signature.

It is no doubt one of the best sounding earphones at this price but I have 2pairs and both of them has problem with sound from left earbud.1st was functioning till 6months then I noticed sound decrease in left earbudOrdered a new pair same problem.but this time it worked just for a month.......not gonna order another I am done

tilte: A quality pair of earphones lacking in the durability department.
review_body: A decent pair of earphones, and pretty damn solid for the untrained ear. It's fairly loud, and a little heavier on the bass side which at times makes the audio a little murky, but for the most part, above average at this price range. The most disappointing feature about these earphones is the quality of the materials used to make it. Nothing short of awful, it's very fragile and if not given extreme care will break. Heck even the cheap ‚Çπ300 MI earphones have better build quality than this. So, an absolute no go for rough users.I would recommend this to casual home listener's who can take care of their gear.

tilte: Great sound low bass & very loud
review_body: Previously I was using cx180 & cx213 & many more earphones but under 1000 rs.For experiment i bought this earphone cx275s believe me i was shocked why sennheiser do that with this earphone?! the sound was great no problem but only one thing i didn't like it the lack of bass the bass is there but medium-low in it the cx180 & cx213 have much better bass than this 1500 rs earphone it's like a type of waste of money & even the bass & treble i didn't find much clarity on this earphone lows highs & mids are good just like cx213 & cx180 i saw every reviews on YouTube they say that the bass is good,great blah blah blah on this earphone but i say don't waste your money go for other brands like sony,jbl you won't be disappoint or if you need a good pair of earphone only sennheiser brand then go to cx213 or cx180 that have much better clarity & quality & if you say noise cancellation then yeah it have but very little at this price point can't complain this is my honest review i think it would be helpful for you.

tilte: King of earphones in the price range Rs 500 to Rs 1700
review_body: If you drink a cup of coffee from Cafe Coffee Day, Indian Coffee House and Saravana Bhavan, you will definitely say the quality of coffee in one of these shops is excellent, for the simple reason that it has a better aroma flavour and taste.Similarly the quality of sound with this earphone is better than and other earphones I had used.The best earphone you can buy in this price range.Perfect package with all items as mentioned in the description.Bass, Treble and mid range very good(excellent in this price segment)(Bass should not be compared with an over the ear headphone, they are really superb)I had listened to many earphones of this price range (1000 +/- 500) and many earphones approach, say 80%, near to this sound quality. But this is superb.Many earphones have many other features like nylon braiding, tangle free, etc, etc. But none comes near this in terms of the sound quality.The mic is really very good and is very accurate in voice typing.

tilte: The most horrible wire quality. Can't even go to service center due to Covid19.

They don't even include a microphone with this for which I had to face problems for working from home, but I decided to buy it for its sound quality. Now how do I even claim warranty that comes with it, due to the ongoing COVID situation? Rubbish. 1 star.

I work in a multinational company and i take calls and i have a Sennheiser head set to do that therefore i knew how good that was . Therefore i with out hesitant went for this product additionally as it also falls under the very low price category for such a brand giant. As most of you knew its quite a hit with the music lovers. My primary observation its very much on the bass centric , volume at 70 percent is absolutely good for bass lovers. Low and mids has some problems few light vocals go miss and sound gets muffled. As per some techies they said burn in for few hours releases the full potential which i did for almost 80 hours. Now i find it good . Definitely i would recommend to buy under the budget class. On the negative aspect the wire used is very cheap and it gets tangled a lot and you also fear if its gonna break so delicate. earphones fit into very nicely but its totally plastic build. if you can waive of these few exceptions you will definitely enjoy the rest. By the way delivery by amazon was spot on. Thank you.

I'll divide my review in 3 parts durability sound quality  and conclusionDurabilityThe headset has a 1.2 m cable, with the microphone and remote located on the cable leading to the earpiece. The headset has a plastic and rubber build. The cable is prone to tangling and also a little on the thin side. Durability can be an issue as a result, so if your earphones get rough treatment this is probably not the model for you.Sound qualityThe company state the earphones have bass-driven stereo sound, which is accurate. They are more on the balanced side than some of the other earphones in the CX line, although the bass definitely has a bit of a boost. The midrange is clear and the treble is fairly pleasant. They aren‚Äôt audiophile quality earphones but they perform respectably for the price-point. The microphone also performs well during calls.ConclusionThe Sennheiser CX 275S isn‚Äôt a terrible product although it does fall down in several areas. Sennheiser got the audio and microphone set-up right. However the headset is not very durable and the lack of volume controls on the remote definitely bring it down a peg or two.The Sennheiser CX 275S offers good audio performance, although it has a fragile build and does not include volume controls.

This is my second Sennheiser ear phone where the volume has gone down significantly within 4 months of buying the product. I have tried to contact the service center multiple times but no one picks up the phone. Will not recommend this product to anyone.

I've been using this pair for over a month now. It works fine so far and the only reason I've given it a 3 star rating is because Amazon has delivered it on time and given me an original product.However, I'm disappointed in sennheiser. The sound quality isn't that great for the price range. I feel skullcandy, jbl and JVC were better brands I've used. They were all cheaper than this one too.The wire is extremely thin. I've seen thicker woolen strings to be honest. The manufacturing charges of this product might be about 2$ and they've charged the consumer about 11$.The plastic is feeble, the insulation is thin and I'm pretty sure the cable inside won't be too great because if they have used cheap materials for the outside, I can only imagine how bad the parts that the consumer cannot see might be.That being said, it is original and I've checked with the registration number on the pack.This pair has lovely noise cancelling and is good for film sound effects; average for music and I don't really listen to R&B but if you do, be warned the bass is below average.If you need a pair for travel music then a single tug on the public transport would probably ruin the wire.

Checking out the reviews of other users, it seems unlikely that the issue I am facing is common.The headphones I got unfortunately have almost no bass. The sound quality is terrible.It probably means that the piece I got were defective.Since I gave this as a gift, and realized the sound quality was poor much later, it's  unlikely I can return the product.Anyhow, it's not Amazon's fault. Hopefully, other buyers don't face any problem with it.

But one can afford a few hundreds then quality is assured.thanks for the quick delivery of cx180 thou it was delivered in good form without any wear and tear.keep up d good work.üëç

tilte: good for hearing voices, treble is too high and bass is less, and not upto expectations
review_body: I have purchased this after my MX 170 stopped working after 5 years. Such was the quality of the latter, that i decided to go with Sennheiser.My first impression was that, the connecting wires were very thin and looked like they could break easily.Also, you don't get an L-jack with this. This becomes a problem when the wire near the jack stays always bent when connected, which might lead to future loose connections.Regarding sound quality:Overall volume is higher than MX 170. This increase in volume is acheived by increasing the treble portion of the sound spectrum, so you can hear higher frequency sounds easily. Human voices sound crystal clear and so crisp that I can even hear the breathe of singers' in songs. Excellent for having online audio conferences, and you can hear what others say very clearly. But the downside of having such a high treble is that high pitched voices sound louder, especially when female voices start appearing, you feel as if the volume has increased suddenly. Cymbals in music also sound amplified.So, by no means it is a balanced sound profile. Bass is much lesser than treble, and those portions of music with just bass beats sounds damped. In an effort to increase the bass, when you increase the volume, treble also gets increased accordingly, and once your speaker volume goes above 60 % or so, your ear starts to hurt because of high pitches being loud.Microphone clarity is just acceptable.In a nutshell, this product is made for music with lots of treble content, human speech and is good for such music or attending phone calls and online meetings, but not having a balanced sound profile, punchy music can't be enjoyed.Because of the lack of bass, I am forced to return this product in exchange for refurbished Sony xb55ap which is 300‚Çπ less.

tilte: Underwhelming compared to my old CX 180
review_body: I bought this since my 7 months old CX 180 started having issues with bass, although I'm planning to have it replaced by the service center since it's still under the warranty period.Now the biggest displeasure that I experienced with this earphone was very weak and degraded bass after just 2 days of using it, which is pretty similar to the issue that I recently started facing with my CX 180. The mids and highs are quite fine, except for very minor distortion in vocals and instrumental highs, that too only if the volume is close to high. I'm quite positive that this is a case of faulty earphones and I'm waiting for the replacement that is supposed to be delivered to me within 2 days from now.

tilte: But if Ur not a bass lover
review_body: Less bass with more clarity. Idle for long listeners and not recommended for bass lovers. You won't stress out even after listening for hours. Am using this from past 4 years and I don't see any wear n tare on it and also because I handled it carefully

Pros:1) Good design & comfort.2) Bass-driven sound.Cons:1) Mids & highs are muted.2). No microphone & in-line remote.Overall Opinion:The Sennheiser CX180 is an in-ear canalphone-style headset, and has a frequency response range of 20-20,000Hz. It also has an impedance rating of 16Ohms and a sensitivity of 110dB. The headset does not have an in-line microphone and remote, and has a standard 1.2m cable. The sales package includes three sets of ear-tips in different sizes.On the design front, the Sennheiser CX180 is simple and functional. Made entirely of plastic, the earphones have a glossy finish on the front and a dull finish on the back, which has been designed in such a way that it's possible to grip each earphone between your finger and thumb for insertion and removal. It's also incredibly light and comfortable, which ensures ease of use over long periods. The only flaw is the cable, which is thin, tangle-prone, and extremely susceptible to cable noise. There is a clear boost in the bass, and this is done to appease the majority of buyers in this price range who look for bass and attack. The vibrations from the bass can definitely be felt, without getting excessive.Finally, with State Of The Art, based on the soundstaging and vocal quality of the CX180. There is no soundstaging to speak of, with the sound appearing two dimensional and simplified. Where better headphones succeed in creating an image in your head, the CX180 has you feeling as though the sound is originating from a single location, or at best a narrow zone. Vocals don't quite have as much power, but are certainly able to work themselves over the boosted bass.

tilte: Deep bass, crisp treble and clear vocals!! Balanced output!!
review_body: These earphones are famous for their overall sound quality but let me elaborate- the bass is deep and soft, treble is crisp and the vocals are clear! Won't feel uncomfortable even after hours of usage. I've sometimes fallen asleep while these earphones on. Absolutely comfortable if compared to its competition. The quality of wire is good and sturdy. Fit and finish is top notch! In this price range this is the best earphone if you are into music. Just one drawback is that it doesn't have a mic.

Many reviews are available on other aspects. What I experienced is totally unexpected. The headphone is so light weight that it remained in my trousers and went into washing machine. It survived a complete cycle of 45-50 minutes and came out unscathed. I used hair dryer to evaporate water inside the grill. Performance unaffected. Please take good care of this one of the best and simplistic earphone. It is not meant to be waterproof.Cons: Price is little on higher side considering there is no microphone and controls.

I am writing this review after 2 months use of this item.German made earphones are best.One of the best I can say. The sound quality is crystal clear, you won't miss anything.In fact I was surprised, as I could hear many small musical instrument's effect which I never hear so far.Built quality is also good.The only concern is I wish to have a L shaped jack..I would say better than any other wireless earphones which would cost you more than 3 k.Take it from me you won't be disappointed even if you choose this one on comparison with any wireless earphones.

tilte: What was committed did not turn up
review_body: I purchased it in February 2018 and there is a two years of warranty also on this. Its one speaker not working after 9 month onwards. Upon sending complain to Sennheiser, they said please come to Gurugram service centre from Noida just for repair. Even they dont have facility of picking up this article. Such purchase is not good for people who are staying in Noida/Ghaziabad as they will suffer a lot after the problem arises in product. Once they sell it, they dont care about customer and talk anything but they dont know that those are the customers who will never come back to purchase it again, neither they will recommend any one.

I bought this on Jan 25, 2015. Four and half years later it's still kicking. The silicone ear tips are slightly worn out, but that's it. Everything else is perfect, the cables, mic, button are all good and durable. I've had another branded earphone from Jabra that didn't even last 4 months. Coming to the most important part of these headphones. Sound. I'm someone who listens to songs with beats and some unplugged songs. Both sound great. Bass is excellent but not the best. None of the other instruments or vocals are distorted, no matter how heavy the bass is. Mic works very well too. To conclude, of you're looking for a branded, good sounding and durable headphone Cx275s will not disappoint. Oh and btw, I ALWAYS kept the earphone in the included pouch when not in use.

tilte: Doubt about the originality of the product.
review_body: Terrific sound for sure. Very crisp and clear. It is made considering music lovers what they need. Adding a bit extra bass would be icinng on the cake but it's alright.I've purchased this by seeing the reviews and it's paid off for me. I'm very happy with the purchase. Got it at 550/- on a deal.But I've a doubt is it a original product or not.  Because description of the product shows mike is not available for this but mine is working with mike. Taking 2 star back as I'd given 5 star before.

If you enjoy musics too much ( with high bass and all) don't go for this, go for JBL. If sound clarity is wht you love go for this. Listening music in this is not that enjoyable, you can hear the voice very clearly but not the 'dish dish boom boom'.

Nothing special if only you want to use mic then go for it good if you really want to it used for for listening music then don't go for these earphones that is distort while using with equaliser or at high volume better go for XB55 or XB75 Sony earphones which i purchased one month after this one. I think I have used XB350 earphones of Sony earlier for 2 years that is why I was not satisfied but the thing is that the build quality of these Sennheiser earphones is not good and also have distortion. Go for Sony XB55 if you really want great sound blindly.Pic attached, one side sienhieser and one side Sony xb75ap.

Pros:1. Nice Sound quality (4/5)2. Earphone fits easily (3.5/5)3. Call quality while receiving call is good (4/5)Cons:1. Build quality is not that great because of thin wire. Either it will get cut off or tangled easily, you have to be bit careful(2.5/5) for build qualityOverall  Value for money. You will get best earphone in mid range earphone.

It is for clarity of sound. Keeping Price in mind - it could be one of the best options. Excellent for calls. Good for Music. It is quite balanced. This is not for Bass lovers at all - about right on all bands. Loudness is perfect. You will probably not need to play it full volume ever.Cable is not sturdy or strong - be careful not for rough use.Apart from that it comes with required stuff - like variable size tips - choose carefully to get Noise Cancellation.Very Light and comfortable - you will not feel it.It has everything that is a sign of great design - L - Shape Connector, Leather Bag.Given the on-the-go use case that this product is primarily for - a Good Sturdy cable is the only thing that I marked it 4 start for - otherwise - it is highly recommended.

Sennheiser is the most trusted brand when it comes to sound quality, and CX 275S will not disappointed you for sure.The sound quality is amazing, the vocals are crisp and clear, bass is also not done extra,whenever the bass is required it comes and goes off, giving us balanced sound signature. (Trebles are slightly boosted, so is the case with CX180, But better than cx 180 for sure)The noise isolation is also awesome,as the eartips completely blocks outside noise, I usally wear them in mumbai locals and after wearing I cannot hear the train moving or sound of train tracks, people etc. So with you might listen sounds loudly with normal volume.The cable quality is also good except for the jack. With earphones(in box) though you are provided with an extra "L" shaped Jack but for me the "L" shaped didn't work with my mobile and I had my original cable broken from the side of jack.Overall if you are a rough user, you may once think over buying them. It hurts when such a earphone gets broken. Sennheiser should probably take a look for cable quality.But they are damn addictive, you might buy another, even if they are broken, as this sound quality is not available in any where near this range.P. S. - I am a avid music listner.

I bought this product on 7/05/2019 the product is totally not worth 1500. I bought this thinking that Sennheiser is a good choice regarding headphones but m really disappointed with it as after 1st month of my products purchase its mic stopped working and today my headphones also stopped working and the company claims that its product worth a 1.5k n when i visited its service centre they refused to entertain my request to fix the headphones!Totally a waste of a product those who are reading this please dont buy these headphones they are totally not worth it!

tilte: V-Shaped great Clear Sound with good bass; Cons: High treble, Recessed vocals, overpriced
review_body: First better than many mass consumer headphones in Sound clarity.Note: Audiophiles/Purists who prefer uncoloured , neutral, flat sound better buy "Hifiman RE400" headset from headphonezone @1999/.Build Quality: wire has average build quality.But have 2 years warranty with few service centres.Cx275s Sound: V-Shaped Sound signature, very clear with Excessive treble .Slight improvement over CX180.. only edge over cx180 is wrt Music+ mic control function and slightly better natural tone with high bass, increased maximum loudness of 121dB. Treble felt dominant too . It may be annoying for few types of songs.If you have cx180 no need to switch unless mic or music control functions are required.Tested with my smartphone and FiiO X3ii .Declaration: Don't expect  heavy bass in either cx180 or cx275s like Sony XB series; which are having significant recessed vocals.Also as per own preference needed to lower high frequencies via equaliser for making bass more enjoyable ; this will control excessive treble(brightness) too .I have Rs 700/ Creative EP-630(using 3rd pair since 2010) too. It has better  sound signature than Sennheiser Cx275s. EP-630 had gained immense popularity in past.I have natural uncoloured sounding  AKG K240-mkii, Hifiman RE400a(similar priced) . They are professional or audiophile quality headphones anyway.Cx275s will be liked by people enjoying V-shaped sound signature.My suggestion: For Rs 1999/ one can buy "Hifiman - RE400" instead which has almost flat, natural, quality sound output. Much better than cs275s. Choose android/type C/iphone variants as needed.cx275s MRP should be 1500/.Keep product box safe to claim 2 years Sennheiser warranty.Limited service centres ; lucky if you are nearer  else be ready to use courier service to exchange your product in warranty period.

tilte: Sennheiser CX180 II Street Best in Class headset.
review_body: Osm earphone as all know. This is a Best in Class headset.Bass is smooth,balanced & clear[Stereo bass].Sound quality n clarity is Awesome.Build quality of earpieces is nyc.Comfortable as it's light in weight.Notice cancellation is also good as it sit properly in ear.But if you wanted to know about cord quality it's not bad but could have been better.Not good for rough use. Wire can be damaged or torn if not maintained well.It has no mic n multifunction button.Overall best in class u can expect.It's really Osm except:- wire quality, No mic and it tangles some time. Wire would have been flat.

tilte: Non bass earphone. For music go for Sony
review_body: Just Ok type. I'm not impressed at all. It is overpowered with tons of treble and bass is way too low, almost zero while listening without equalizer. I just use it at home for watching youtube videos. It's not a my cup of tea, anyway.Forget deep bass. It doesn't even have normal balanced bass. Wires are thin and not tangle free. No mic.I'm a sony user. I have five sony headphone, two of them are wireless neckband and this one is not close to the balance sound sony provides.Sure this one has more clarity and treble but without bass, music listening is not pleasent at all.Even equaliser can't help much. Sony doesn't need any Equalizer.Clarity: 9/10Treble: 9.5/10Bass: 4/10Noise cancellation: 5/10Comfort: 8/10Overall a very bad choice for music. Even local earphones worth rupee 150 have more bass than this. It sounds like steel plates bashing in your ears. I wonder why it has too high ratings?Don't buy for music. Especially EDM. Go for sony If you care about sound quality.

Reviw afte 4 months:The earphones are good to buy in sub 700 price range. However i felt that the treble output for high frequency sound is not good. It seems like screaming. The bass is fine and is not overlapping on other sounds. I expected to use it for at least one year but the insulation of the cable got cut automatically in 4 months. And now i would have to tape it and make it ugly. I don't know if warranty covers that too. For sound quality, sennheiser is first choice, closely followed by JBL.

tilte: Good looking and good (not great) sounding earphones
review_body: I wanted to try sennheiser's sound signature as I tested out JBL's too. So I wanted to start with these earphones, these are not bad at all.It has a catchy look and design I mean lot of people will recognize these pairs. Sound quality can differ on your taste.I come from Audio Technica which provides flat sound experience which I prefer (you can always fancy the EQ).So these pairs provide great stereo separation with good amount of bass. Treble is punchy but the mids definitely go missing. But that's what people like I mean most of them won't notice it.Also, the delivery was so fast I can't believe it - I placed the order last night and received it today morning, didn't request any early delivery or something. Part of the reason could be that it was shipped from same city.

tilte: Small size but sounds like beast
review_body: Senhieser can't be judged in sound quality but guys feel free to go for this one if you really looking for great sound quality in this budget. The earphone have very balanced configuration of midtones,bass, and treble. It's like bass suddenly come into effect when it's in the audio. You might feel high treble and low bass level if you're a bass lover. But believe me these pair of earphone have sound quality which you will get in 1500-2000 budget earphone.. it even plays very low signal it means you won't miss sound of any instruments played in background in audio signal and it's not gonna attenuate any frequency.

tilte: Good quality headset for somebody who likes clear balanced sound.
review_body: Well, the product was delivered late by one day, but better late than never. The packaging is neatly done, with no evidence of tampering.External noise cancellation is pretty good and surrounding noise is dampened well.I have used this headset for listening to 256kbps MP3 files with Poweramp full version installed on my phone and Winamp media player installed on my computer.The bass quality is not that loud, but overall, the components of music are well balanced with no tones overshadowing another. Treble is clear, but bass is not loud, a feature which I like. Clearly this is not the headset of choice for somebody who likes deep bass in their music.There are two extra sets of ear buds provided in the sales pack which you can change and use according to your comfort and choice. The ear bud fits snugly into your ear and does not fall off during jogging or cycling etc.Regarding the built quality, I guess it is okay for a price lower than 1000 bucks. But its durability will be known with passage of time.Note: It is not recommended for somebody who likes deep bass in their music.

Got CX 275 S for ‚Çπ1600.All good:1. Music like never before2. Bass is perfect even without mobile synchronisation3. Noise cancellation is awesome4. Comes with two pins (one is in built to the wire for attaching to mobiles and PCs, while the other is detachable and can be used for walkmans and Car Aux)5. Tried recording sound on DU screen recorder and found that sound clarity was such that even car honks at 10-15m are also recorded very fine..which may be a poor thing for Youtubers who are advised to record in a closed AC room(as even sound of running fan will be recorded :) away from roads by atleast 20m.6. Also comes a handy pouch of great quality for saving the device from rain and damage.7. Completely tangle free..Upper double wire is fitted with a knob to adjust the distance one needs for mic..lower wire is single (so no chance of getting tangled)My suggestion:must buy for Music listeners, traffic users, youtubers. Amazing purchase. Better than expectation. Better than even Sony earphones that used to come with Mobiles once upon a time :D

tilte: Worth it but a little low on bass
review_body: The over sound quality is good. The tone is more over neutral and a bit soft on the bass. The sound isolation is good as long as the rubber buds fit properly in your ear canal. Although a good product I do miss the volume controls and assistant invoking features. Don‚Äôt expect a heavy punchy bass.

tilte: Sennheiser cx 180 vs Boat bass heads 225
review_body: Sennheiser cx 180 is the best pair of earphones you can get for 800rs. I got them during the sale for 500rs and they're greatSound is solid with decent bass .I've even used boat bass heads 225 which is great under these price segments I've compared them belowBoat bass heads 225Pros : solid build quality ( metal heads )  Tangle free cable  Decent bass and sound quality  Comes with decent micCons : they're heavy keeps falling off from  Ears  Distortion when heard at high levelSennheiser cx 180Pros : solid sound quality  Decent bass  Light weight very comfyCons : plastic build  Thin cables  Without micConclusionIf you're looking for an all-around earphones and prefer mic go for boat bass heads 225If you just use them for listening to music or watching movies go for Sennheiser cx 180

One of the most regrettable purchases. Sound quality is absolutely horrible. Tested on various sources like 4 different phones, DAP, Headphone amps. Pathetic. Item is only replaceable and not refundable. My friends Mi Piston earphones are way better than this. Very thin and flimsy build to add to the agony.

tilte: Amazing earphones over the years!! No match !!
review_body: I don‚Äôt think there is any match for these Sennheiser earphones !!! Absolutely amazing !!!I had an earlier version of these from last 5 years and just because they worn out I had to keep them aside.. I‚Äôve had iPhone‚Äôs earpads, audio technica, Sony, Phillips, mi n few others, nothing satisfies as these do. The moment you have them in your ears, it reduces 40% of external noise(remember these are wired earphones).The sound(music, voice, movie) it just heard in your head. Not the ears..,!!

I was expecting so much from sennheiser but it turns out to be just average.The sound is okayish...certainly not worth price and it doesn't have a mic either.My issue is with high pitch of sound that this earphone has...and I think that is painful for ears if not harmful.

tilte: Yes, Buy It, For a laptop
review_body: very nice pair of headphones the design and form is good, especially the clip near the audio jack for holding excessive wire in a loop its just like as if they just read my mind.This kind of headphones is superb for laptop use, i will recommend this, hell i will buy this once again, Bass is top quality, where was this headphone 10 years ago,i spent a lot of money on headphones i feel like this is a gift i am giving myself its original and cheap.

I purchased these from a local shop in Sector 17, Chandigarh in 2017. It was an impulsive purchase, i had absolutely no idea that these are one of the best earphones in the market. Unfortunately after a rigorous usage, they had a small issue. I wasn't keeping them properly and lost interest after a little while.Got them at a good price from Amazon. Love the quality. I have also used We Cool Bluetooth earphones and figured out i don't need those. The charging and all that is a bit of a hassle.  The CX 180 is simply amazing. I cannot go into the details because i am no expert here but the quality speaks for itself. Once you get accustomed to a cozy seat in lets say a Maybach or Rolls Royce, you won't feel as comfortable in a Honda Accord. Its the same way with Sennheiser CX 180. Once you use them, you'll start missing them when you downgrade. Audio is superb, everything is crisp and clear. I keep my phone at 70% volume and it's still loud enough. Bass is very good, does not crack, its punchy and sweet. Everything is so well balanced, there's nothing more one could ask for. They are also lightweight and look quite sober.I am retaining the We Cool earphones pad for my CX180. I have also seen few videos as to how to keep these in mint condition. Keep them safe, use them properly and these won't disappoint you at all.

I can see why this one has so many fans. Extremely clear and natural audio and the most comfortable in ear headphones that I have used so far.In this price range, I will definitely recommend these if mic is not essential. With mic, you can go for the realme buds 2. Lastly, there is always the jbl c100si, c150si ( all same sound quality ).Build quality is okayish here. I had not expected realme buds 2 to excel but they do. The wires are really thin here. I bought this only for the hype they get and to be honest, these are actually so good in terms of sound and sound only. Sennheiser has a 2 yr warranty so no complaints.Bass is more punchy in the realme buds 2, highs are also good there. But the cx 180 offers a more natural and balanced output where you miss nothing. Nothing is over emphasized here. See, I am bringing the realme buds 2 again because they exceed expectations even though they are not as experienced in this field as the Sennheiser.But here is the thing. I feel more comfortable with the cx 180. The ear buds are small, the ear tips are perfect, the sound stage is brilliant, the highs feel more alive, the bass kicks in where needed, the vocals are super clear too. These headphones do justify the good reviews here. But if you need a mic and a better build quality with a minor compromise in terms of the overall sound signature, then you know which ones I would recommend. Nothing against JBL, but they do not last more than 8 months.Update: Within 5 months, the wires have started to crack. Still the best sounding earphones but the wires are too bad.

tilte: Super sound quality but worst durability
review_body: When you buy this earphones you have to keep in mind that with good quality sound you have to make some compromises when u buy it. Let me explainProGood thing is the sound quality. Its exceptionally good. Cristal clear sound. Superb clearer bass. Every sound is clearer through this earphones.COns1. Durability is setback . You have to take good care of this product or you will lose this item very early. In 4 months the wire has multi breaking points(16) on the coating . You can see the wires through this2. Tangling is headache every time you try to pickup the earphones.3. Inside Ear has pain after using it for more than 2 hours on above 70% volume on Ipod Shuffle classic and realme Xt. If u keep it below that no pain in the ears .

tilte: Value for money - Very Good, just short of excellent
review_body: Used the earphones for over 7 hours today on a train journey, absolutely no fatigue or any kind of irritation on or in the ears, the large caps provide a snug fit and cancel out external noise to a great extent, the wires look deceptively thin, but can make out it is quality build, reason for 4* & not 5*is because the wires get tangled way too easily and frequently, which is very annoying, also not rating below 4*is purely coz of the worldwide warranty it's not going to WOW at this price range is my personal opinion, definitely more than a good product without doubt, especially comfort level (4.5)update : after 6 months of use, it's sturdy as hell! Definitely worth the money

tilte: Good earphones from Sennheiser for a tight budget.
review_body: I like these sennheiser CX275s. For this price It offers good sound, good bass and good noise cancellation for such price.Cx275s may not be the best sounding earphones but they are pretty great for all it offers for such price. I got it for Rs1200.Inbuilt microphone with single button remote, for receiving & ending calls, play, pause and change song, which makes it pretty convenient. Eartips are comfortable in the ear plus you get 3 pairs of eartips in 3 different sizes. Additional cable adapter makes it compatible with almost all the smartphones. Though the cable is very thin but looks sturdy but gets entangled easily.2 year warranty makes it a 'GREAT BUY' for people who are on 'TIGHT BUDGET' and looking for good quality earphones with mic especially for their smartphones, from a brand like Sennheiser. Honestly it's a steal.

IMPORTANT: This earphone is a quality product. Anywhere below ‚Çπ1400 it is a great buy. The value does drop below ‚Çπ1400 on sale and special occasions.DESCRIPTION:Included with the earphone is a beautiful leather pouch and differently sized earbuds.The bass is good and the audio clear.You may think it is fragile but it will surprise you.The wire is mostly tangle free.Noise cancellation is good too.

So I have been using the current pair of CX 275s for more than 6 months now. I use them regularly on my daily commute (of an hour) to work on my bike as well as in the office for Skype calls (which usually means nearly 4-4.5 hours out of the 9 hours at work)The Sound quality is good. However, if you are looking for extra bass then perhaps these may not be where you should be looking at.They are quite comfortable for regular use and the noise-cancellation is quite good at this price point. The 2 year warranty that is provided, makes these the most bang for buck earphones. If ever, you face issues with the earphones as long as they are within the warranty period, replacement is quite hassle free. (Applies to the CX180 as well which I owned earlier as well)To sum it all up, if you are looking for a good pair of multi-purpose earphones for regular use you cannot go wrong with these.

Man for Rs.699 these earphones are awesome!The Bass exists and it's perfect it's not overdone and all the songs/movies sound good on there.I have used a lot of earphones my primary ones are AirPods 2 and trust me there are very close to how they sound.Also for those planning to get JBL C200SI don't buy these, you won't regret.My only complaint is about the build quality it's really average but again they cost only Rs.699 so I can't really complain about it.

tilte: Nice earphones for the price, questionable durability
review_body: Don't think these are suitable to working out but are pretty good for general lifestyle usage. The wire is long but is meant to only stretch upto an extent, do NOT test its durability. Sound and mic quality is pretty good, I've been using it for 2 years almost and quality is still brilliant.The silicon ending of the earphone might break but it's not noticeable, the important problem is that the earbuds fall off when you use it a lot as it becomes looser, you get a replacement back (although different sizes only) so that's good.I'd say if you're looking for cheap, good earphones with a mic, this is the one.

Recently I purchased this earphone from Amazon and I‚Äôm thoroughly satisifed with the product. The seller Cloudtail delivered it timely. I researched a lot about earphones before buying and fixed onto this. The Sony earphones with extra bass are quite expensive, the Skullcandy ones do not last long and so  Sennheiser being a reputed brand I took this. This is the best-selling earphone under Rs. 1000. I will now discuss what I liked about this:1. Sound quality - First and foremost, the sound quality is amazing. It‚Äôs very crisp and bass is ok too. The highs and mids are clear and can hear every beat. With proper equalizer this can be a beast. Anyways, the lows can be managed as they can‚Äôt be crystal clear on an expensive one too.2.Comfort - The earphone looks to be durable and last for a long time. Yes, the wire is thin but coming from a well established brand it will not wear easily.3. Packaging - The box was well packed and you will find the earphones along with changeable earbuds. The box may not be as stylish like that of the Sony ones but quite decently it is packed.4. Price - Under Rs. 1000 it‚Äôs a deal because you get a complete package with good branded earphones and crisp sound that will shake your soul. If you are bass-head then you can go for Sony MDR-XB30EX else this one‚Äôs perfect for you. Overall, I am loving music on this earphone and been over 3 months with no issues.

tilte: bass is very heavy.. bass treble clarity loudness all is 10 on 10
review_body: if you want earphones with 100% crisp and crystal clear sound then go for these earphones. bass treble clarity you get everything even at high volumes. infact these earphones will even encourage you more to increase volumes more and more. sound effects will incredibly get better and punchy with increasing volumes. its really pleasant experience listening to music in these earphones. you will not be tired even if you listen to songs the entire day. these earphones will give ample amount of heavy thumping ground shaking bass effect.

tilte: Best for those who want crystal clear sound in overall frequency range.
review_body: I think sennheiser has degraded the built quality of these pair of earphones I'm saying this on behalf of my personal experience because I have been using this earphones from 2015(from croma at rs 1600) and again I bought it in dec 2018 but from Amazon at rs1585 (price in croma rs 1699 on dec.25.2018). I found the sound quality is still ok but they have degraded the built quality .

These are incredible Headphones. I had bought a one three years back. There is hardly any damage to the headphones. I use them for taking calls, listening to music, working out, etc and they seem to hold ground everywhere.The buds fit snugly into the ear and the headphone doesn't slip even when working out.The music quality is excellent.The bass is punchy and not super thumping. The mids and highs are balanced. I used songs like Jumbalika, Thriller, etc to test them and you can feel the different instruments distinctly.Recently I had wanted to buy new ones and found that these stand in comparison to 1More Dual Driver and Boat Nirvana Tres Headphones in most features.I'm quite satisfied with this buy.

tilte: Unbeatably good at this price range
review_body: Writing this review after using multiple headphones through years and my experiences with Skull Candy, JBL, Boat etc.This is undoubtedly the best headphone that you can buy at this price range. Sennheiser are known for their elite ness in audio world and their expensive ness tooüòÑ. But if you could buy these at this price range, don't even try other options.The thing I like most among other qualities like sound quality, crispiness and good frequency response is it's size. It's small size sits very comfortably in ear(I faced lot of issues with this point with other headphones).The only con that I see here is it comes without mic. The varient which comes in with mic is expensive.

tilte: E10C much much better than CX 275s
review_body: Sound quality:Bass: Tight and punchy bass not like the deep bass which is found in Sony earphones.Vocals: Clear but lacks depth.Treble:  So high that sometimes it hurt your ears. Also it overpowers the vocals in some edm songs.Noise cancellation: Average, it does not block the ambient noise when listening in low volume.Instrument separation:Has a narrow sound-stage, hence noticing instrument separation is difficult.Built quality: Average. Wire gets tangled.Comfort: Excellent, can wear full size helmet with them without hurting the ears.Better alternative:Soundmagic E10C. It has better sound-stage and produces quality vocals with adequate bass and comfortable treble. If you like to listen acoustics and unplugged genre songs, then E10C beats CX 275s by a huge margin.Hope this helps. Thanks for reading.

tilte: Fantastic product from Sennheiser at affordable priceüôèüôÇüëåüëçüëè
review_body: Somepeople are asking me to suggest best earphones under Rs.1000.I suggest Sennheiser CX 180 Street II In-Ear Headphones,it has brilliant sound output but we have to be very careful with the quality of the wire(it is very thin and has average quality).The awesome sound output via earphones matches the sound quality of 10k to 15k price range earphones üôÇüëåüëçüôèüëè.

tilte: Jack of all trades master of some
review_body: I believe in spending a little bit more to get a better experience. But let me tell you this, I haven't seen a single pair of earphones that cost under 1200INR and are as good as CX180. Sure, some of them have better bass, mic, controls, better build quality, etc. But all of them usually focus on one thing and sacrifice on other features.I love CX180 because they focus more on highs and mids with reasonable bass. Also they're so tiny that you can comfortably put them under your helmet and I love the ear tips. They're soft.This is my 7th purchase of CX180. That's how much I like them. But it surely has one problem that just irritates me the most, the wires are too slim. Because of this, they usually last for 5-6 months for me. I really wish Sennheiser update CX180s with thicker and more durable cable.

If it falls in your budget, get it. That's all there is to it.I was restricting my budget to 900 because I have never felt the need for an expensive earphone despite my dialy use,so I kept pushing my purchase of the 275 for 3 years. Finally I decided to get it and it's great. I loved the cx 180 and this is even better. Very crisp,clear and decent noise masking. It's light,it's comfortable. It's got a mic that makes superb calls. I don't think you can beat this ,despite the premium over the JBL c100SI
