tilte: You won't get anything better for this price
review_body: I actually owned the Sony product that is a direct competitor to these earphones, but I lost them. I've been meaning to try Sennheiser for a long time, and I finally got the excuse.These and the Sony are neck to neck. There is no real big difference between them. But regardless, I would say the Sennheiser are my favorites. I wish they have a volume adjuster, but as long as they have a mic it's not a big deal. I like the music quality, playing at medium-high volume mutes most things around you. I'm a college student and travelling on the bus is easier with these earphones. They are also pretty durable. I've been rough with them, but they function flawlesslyThank you for including a carrying pouch! That is one of the main selling points.

tilte: Please don't buy this. I beg you. Save money and go for boat
review_body: This a very personal and subjective review guys so please take this with a grain of salt.I am not a "professional" or an "Audiophile" as such but I am very picky with my tech. Because of budget reasons I have been using Mi basics earphones, boat 152 and other such earphones below 500rs range.I was so hyped to buy these earphones after watching reviews on youtube by YouTubers like Geekyranjit and Trakin tech.No offense to any of those guys but tbh, THIS SOUNDS LIKE GARBAGE. ABSOLUTE WASTE OF MONEY. WOULDN'T PAY 200 FOR THESE. Also please keep in mind that this  frustration is coming from a guy who was already happy with his boat 152.There is no mic on this as well. I feel so sad right now that I wasted 730rs on these. Boat 152 has some great bass and it has great volume at 500rsNow some people will argue that I am a "basshead" and that I have no taste in "real music" ....please stop. I was using Mi basics and when I switched to boat 152...it felt like a whole new world of music. I could hear every single frequency range properly and loudly. Now these Sennheisers feel like a step back from that.The high frequencies are tooooo HIGH it hurts my ears when I raise the volume over 60%. The bass is fine but not anywhere near as boats.Just buy the boat 152s guys..You can tinker around with the settings of the equaliser and you'll be good to go.Don't believe people who'll say that you'll experience a "whole new world of music" with Sennheiser and other premium headphones ....it's all B.S.Buy the cheaper ones...that's enough for most of us.I'm a "zero Fs given" kinda guy. The fact that I'm writing this long review should explain the amount of regret I'm feeling right now. I'm utterly disappointed that I can't even return it ( they'll only replace it)

tilte: The best sound but delicate build
review_body: Its best headphone with clear sound and amazing bass, although the effect of base is best while listening it in less noise. As it doesn‚Äôt have any noise isolation but still if it perfectly fit in ears the sound is least effect with considerable noise. That is, it‚Äôs great for general commute. Its mike is also great with it position and recording quality makes it best for calling.Although it‚Äôs not a deal breaker but like me do not expect much with l shaped extension adapter it only works with Samsung or some selected device. And it is also mention on its cover.Comparing it with Sony MDR series (extra bass series) Schneider headphone is way ahead in sound quality, although it depends on your taste but it like Sony MDR series have special punch to bass slightly cutting other aspects like tone quality and treble. Schneider (This model) have almost the same (or better bass) with even better quality of other sound, other than sound it‚Äôs also have superior in comfort and ergonomics.The only thing it lag is the build quality, in almost same price tag Sony MDR series are IP68 and build to last till you are bored with it. While this headphone needs to be treated like a baby and the other trade off with Schneider is lesser service centre in India.So, if you are planning for workout or training music then forget this try Schneider‚Äôs higher sports model or try Sony, Skullcandy etc. but if you are music lover looking only for premium sound quality then it‚Äôs the best in this price range.

tilte: Best  & Quality  Headphone Choice from Sennheiser Brand without extra bucks
review_body: I purchased this item on 6th December 2018. I had totally awesome sound - theater like experience with this Sennheiser CX 180 Street II In-Ear Headphone (Black), without Mic to watch either  a Dolby Digital  5.1 or  DTS surround 1080p Blu-ray Movies with the Asus TUF Gaming FX505DT RYZEN 7 .Earbuds can be selected from system provided DTS Audio app or its control panel custom equalizer  which fully supported it.  For watching movies select content mode as " Entertainment " and " Stereo Pref" as Wide . I am not yet test with playing games yet but expect not less. There is not a problem of using such earbuds longer.It's also quite fine listening to the music in my phone. I could say bass may feel lack to some persons buts its good enough in this price range. Thanks

I already have Senheiser cx 275s which I bought for second time because I absolutely fell in love with them. I use those only for music on the go. I wanted a second cheaper pair for videos and pillow streaming. I had xiaomi basic. They were cool but I was never satisfied with them. Within 6 months they developed problems with the connector.So I ordered these cx 180. I wasn't sure whether I could trust them or not. But as soon as I got them, I plugged them in and boy oh boy, I was amazed. They are meant for people who love bass heavy music. They are light and comfortable in ear. Sleeping them in your ear doesn't pose any problems and you can use them inside helmets too because the module is small, and it won't put a lot of pressure inside your ear.They aren't obviously as clear as cx 275s but for the price point they perform better than xiaomi basic, boat nirvana and even jbl. I personally prefer them over Sony xb55ap, because they are too bulky and the bass dampens the treble too much.Those who have the tendency for rough handling should go for cx 180 because they feel much durable than cx 275s. Cx 180 also gets an angled connector which is much better inside pockets.In my opinion, once one falls in love with SENHEISER, they'll never go back to Sony or jbl for no reason.I am ENTERTAINED.  (I'll add a detailed sound review after its burn in period and at least after 6 months.)Ps : buy a good paid equaliser like power amp and get used to it. One of the best deciding of my life. You have complete control over your experience. Google play and default browsers are useless.

Sennheiser known for sound quality...Well, its true.....the sound it delivered is amazing......bass is also punchier.....in some headphone u may notice treable and vocal drop while playing audio in Poweramp in extra bass mode......but in this case u will not notice any drop....even after pulling the bass slider to full....and most importantly in extra bass it will not hurt ur ear.......I checked the the headphone wid my spotify premium wid no equaliser turned on .....but still u will feel some punch of bass as well.......finally I want to say u will not be disappointed by the sound quality it produce......Microphone is also good....noise cancellation is also good.....But the worst thing u may notice is the wire quality.....but its not soo delicate....still u should take care about it.......in the box u will get a pouch of good quality for carrying ur headphone while travel.......Design wise its just amazing ......u even cant feel that u r wearing a headphone.....after 3-4 hours of uses u will not be irritated ......Last but not the least if ur budget is under 2000 then definitely check it out......üëç

tilte: Good, but be mindful of ear size
review_body: The sound quality is as promised - but be mindful about your ear size. Though the box has the rubber earbuds of different sizes, the earphones themselves were larger than the smaller Sony size that fit my ears just right. So my ears hurt a bit after an hour of usage. tilte: Best in class! (Under Rs 1000) Even better than boat rockerz 400.
review_body: Go for this one if your budget is around 1000. I have tried almost everything under 1000 and boat rockerz 400 which is priced at 1100. If you put sound quality (as in being able to hear every sound clearly) over just bass (as in bass overpowering every other sound), then this is where you should put your money in.It's not like these earphones can't produce bass; use an equaliser and rock up the bass and you will get it.I would recommend this in an under Rs 1000 window. That means it is far better than JBL, Boat, Boult, Sony, or even skullcandy under Rs 1000.

Everything is good in the product.Typical Sennheiser sound signature.Bass 4/5.Bass is accurate and not boomy.Doesn't overpowere other frequencies.Mid: 4/5Vocals are Cristal clear and forward sounding.Treble 4/5Trebles are smooth and do not hurt or cause fatigue to your ears.SoundstageNot bad. There is actually good separation.Can be used for watching movies and listening music.Cons.Cable if not taken care will get damaged especially near the 3.5 mm Jack area. Gets easily Tangled. Looks very delicate.Mic Is not that great. Person on the other end of the call feels you are too far and need to hold the mic closer to your mouth.I have better experience with other brands.Overall:Very good value for money.Ideal for everyday use in the office, travelling.

It may be advertised as a "bass driven" earphone but it is not. This is a good earphone if you only wish to listen to bollywood, classic or any other songs with less or no bass, listen to podcast and stream videos. If you listen to EDM, Hip-Hop or any other music with deep bass it won't live up to your expectations. Treble is decent but bass is inadequate. The clarity of vocals is good but could've been better. However you won't find much issues with the buid quality as it is good. With bass however, don't expect too much or you'll be disappointed.

tilte: Bang for bucks if you're looking for sound quality.
review_body: This is arguably the best sounding earphones you can buy without making a hole in your wallet.The soundoutput is extremely balanced and if you love tweaking with your Equalizer or audio settings while listening to your playlist, this earphone would be the safest bet.It doesn't have any in build noise cancellation method but the in-ear coupling does provide adequate isolation.That being said here are things you need to consider before buying them,1. The bass output is adequate, but not as heavy as the ones from Sony or Mi in this similar price point. So if you're a fan of the "wub-wub", then I would recommend you to avoid these earphones and go for one that accentuate bass more with larger driver.2. These earphone provides a very balanced audio profile out of the box, so if you want to experience the best out of this earphone you need to have a basic understanding of the audio settings and Equalizersnof your phone. Or else you will end up having a mediocre experience out of these great earphones. That being said, this applies on pretty much any earphones TBH.3.the build quality of this earphones are a huge problem. The wires are flimsy and rubbery. Forget about braiding , they don't even come with a earphone pouch or bag l. So be ready to spend a few more bucks to buy a pouch, and protective silicone cover for these earphones if you want a  few good years of use out of them.4. It has a microphone and call button that has a decent sound quality. But do not expect anything extra out of those mic.5. Thankfully the 3.5mm jack is gold plated but it is not a right angle jack so be mindful while using it. Straight jacks gets broken pretty easily compared to right angle ones.That's all folks

tilte: One side stopped working within a month, painful to use
review_body: There are reviews from customers about the same from 2018 and Sennheiser is still selling the product with same problem.Left side stopped working and doesn‚Äôt even last a month. I have handled them with all the care, never dropped, kept cleaned, no wires pulled.I am not a rough user, I have used my Galaxy Note 4 inside box Earphone for 5 years with lesser care than that with the CX 180.===> Very important to know, the noise attenuating ability (says Sennheiser, perfect ear canal fit) creates a pressure on the eardrum, which causes pain, gives headaches and will damage the eardrum for sure. You can feel that right after putting them on.The Samsung earphones used to let out the air between the eardrum and the earphone. They were not painful at all, I have used them 8-10 hours a day playing video games and enjoying music.Bass quality was not that good as at high volume it is more painful.Sound quality is good (I enjoyed my collection of 80s international). You can hear enemies from a long distance in the video games. Believe me with all the experience as I have a collection of music from 320kbps to 2300kbps but nothing matters if the earphones are harmful to your ears.One should always check the sample one in the store to make sure the earphones are made for their ears.For the price of ‚Çπ649 there are many alternatives, Samsung told me that the in-box earphone have an alternative, EHS64. There is Oppo O-fresh with Hi-res certification (lowest available for ‚Çπ699) which I would like to try and soon many will be available with Hi-res. You can spend more money for a Sony. Sony, Samsung and even Oppo will be good options as there are so many service center available in almost all cities.

As a product Sennheiser should be the best. Yes it is quite good but not extraordinary. I was expecting more clarity in the sound while comparing with my 10 months old Skullcandy. I was sad with the output. Secondly the video based advertisement says it comes with a pouch. I didn't find any pouch in the sealed pack. Ok, I live that to for compromise. 3 different sizes of Rubber adaptors were there and it helped. Overall I am just above satisfactory. Thanks.

But, the bass quality, tweets, trebles produced by this Sennheiser CX 180 Street II overpowers even Boat, with about half of its cost. Much liked the music experience. This is an excellent headphones for music lovers and podcast listeners. This product delivers crisp sound as you can hear every single sound and also feel the bass which is in right amount not harmful for ear. The built quality is top notch and it feels premium in your hands.But the wire is mediocre as it million years old type which gets tangled if dont give much attention to it. A flat wire type would have been better. And after two years the wires will break eventually even if you are not using it regularly. But it will serve its purpose of providing heavenly music experience till then.Nevertheless, I won't recomment this product for anyone who want to use during traveling or in outdoors.I bought it twice and I was happy with the first one but second one break my heart. Only one side works after one month of delivery even though I haven't used it much. It turns out getting a replacement is not easy from where i live.Well done Amazon.

I recently bought a Sennheiser CX213 earphone for just Rs.699/- from flipkart ,over the years I have been buying headphones of different makes including Bose & to my pleasant surprise the no frills 213 exceeded all my expectations.The Sennheiser CX 275 S has a mic & comes with add-ons such as a nice leatherette pouch, two pairs of extra earbuds of diff sizes for better ear canal fit and a L cable adapter for Rs.1648 on Amazon but quality and performance wise CX213 is a much better product at less than half the price of  CX 275 S.So if you don't mind the absence of a mic and want to just listen to music or watch videos go for CX213 hands down. Quality of the wire in CX 213 is much better than that of the CX 275 S & longer too.

tilte: Stylish, trendy and Best Sound under 1k budgetHighly Recommended
review_body: Great product from Sennheiser at Rs 800/-. These earphones are very light, ergonomic and fashionable. Their cable is very thin but strong enough to resist normal wear and tear easily. The build quality is decent. Overall, the durability is good at the price tag they come with.Coming to how these sound, perhaps these are the loudest earphones under 1k. They have a high sensitivity of 110db/mw which is higher than any earphone at this price. These pack some tight and punchy bass (mostly upper and musical bass). Sub bass is not promising but you cannot expect an earphone to have everything at this price. Mids are present and at par with what any other earphone has to offer under 1k. Vocals sound very natural and boasts of a great deal of clarity. The highs are very sparkling and crisp but however at loud volumes, they can get a little soaring and distorted (usually after 90% volume). At higher volumes, the lows are dominated by highs which is necessary to ensure they sound detailed and clear. Overall they have a good close to the original sound reproduction except the distortion at high volumes. Bass is not very heavy. Sound is very rich, detailed and crisp.

tilte: Best sounding earphones i have ever used
review_body: CONS:1.There is a small gap between grey and black parts.... i replaced that unit but the replacement unit also had that small gap(i had tried to snap it together... bt gap is still there) and i fear that the product might get water damaged on the long run.2.The wire is too thin and gets tangled easily.Except that the earphone is totally worth the price (i bought it for rs. 649 during the lightning sale just after Prime day sale.)PROS:1.Best audio quality (everything is balanced perfectly ...bass treble vocals all just perfect.....may not be the best choice for bassheads)2.Best inear fit (when used with the correct ear tips)3. 0% audio leakage even at high volume4.Super high volume.. so don't blast songs at full volume,play songs around 60% if you care about your ears(volume of my old  JBL c150si at 100% = 75% of cx180)5.Most comfortable earphone ever(can wear it even while sleeping)6.Good noise isolationAFTER JUST 8 MONTHS OF USE, THE CABLE'S OUTER LAYER HAS COME OPEN EXPOSING WIRES INSIDE. BUY IT ONLY IF YOU CAN TAKE EXTREMELY GOOD CARE FOR IT.

tilte: A small present for my parents & know what!!, they just loved it.
review_body: Dear Purchasers,Don't go by reviews and ratings. Do make some homework before planning your requirement as per desired purposes.Brands like these make sure it delivers a balanced product for instance the treble is little over higher side which can be balanced using equalizer provided either in the phone/app.Bass is set at the right space, if one wants to increase do the same as mentioned above.Sound quality - I couldn't find any specific distortions while either playing music (tested in almost all the genres from hip-hop, jazz, EDM, Indian classical,Bollywood and many more). The audio quality is clear enough to enjoy the crisp details inside music.Calling - it is clear and audible and not too loud as well.Built quality & durability - One must remember electronics are sensitive and taken with care they last longer than expected. Cable is well insulated and sturdy in comparison with other brands. Buds are soft and fits well inside the ears, not to miss out other size buds available to suit one's size of ears to make sit comfortably.Controls - one button, multiple functions (instructions provided in the user manual).Warranty - 24months, do not miss out to be reminded off that if in case of any issues please do reach out the manufacturer for further details.Finally, one might be wondering why 4 stars? 1 star is reduced for the excess treble for which the only solution is to adjust with equalizer suitable to one's own taste. Guy's this is a product from a world renowned manufacturer in sound devices reaching customers under the pricing range of 1.5k. I have been using various earphones and headphones from this maker since 2010 such as in-ear, over-ear, over the head.Hoping my genuine review of this product is helpful.

It's okay for bass lover and treble is okay too.... But it's not worth the price.Cons :-Wires are really very thin... If you are hard user I won't recommend to you.Bass and treble are okay... But when comes to vocalization its terrible.I will prefer boat nirvana (899 inr) over this earphone.Very bad experience.

After using this earphone for past 6 months now i can share my experience-the one who has equalizer setting on their phone can adjust sound  but  for featured phone user this earphone is not worth it,  sound is so pincy, you will never like to listen for a long time. and bass is also not that much good. You can feel the comparison yourself if you ever used headphone(not earphone) beforeout of function after  6 months so quality is also worst in this price range.If you can go for a higher range than don't buy cx180.  In range under 800 go for other earphone that suits best for your experience.

tilte: Button wasnt working and bass is the poorest so was sound quality
review_body: All the YouTubers said that these earphones are the best in this price range...i just want to break it to you... They are not the best earphones... They have the least base and very high treble... All songs started to hear very bad and i really don't get it why senheiser couldnt fix this... They are not selling a budget earphone...2k is very much...believe me i am an audiophile...i had apple earpods before these...and god i loved them...*The button wasnt working btw* So i am returning these and getting another one...and this time...i will not get another vaccum earphone...my ears pained so much after these....i played pubg and idky i started hating m762's sound after wearing these...such high treble...my ears exploded...they are loud definately but in the wrong way... Sound isn't balanced and bass was just absentRest your wish...i don't recommend these at all... Thankyou.

tilte: Stop wasting money and go for cx 180 for 700 inr.
review_body: Look my review will be a bit complicated, I'll compare it to cx 180, and will tell you is there any reason you are spending that extra 900 bucks on 275s.As you have learnt in all of the reviews that it's one of the best earphones your can buy under 2000 bucks, and I'm not denying the fact, the claim is indeed true. But coming from cx 180 i find the sound quality very similar, i repeat very very similar, ok, i get it, the signature Sennheiser sound will be same on both as they are from the same brand, i have tested it side by side with cx 180 for literally 2 days, and there is no significant sound quality difference. I think this is not acceptable, I'm spending my extra 900 bucks only for a very very minor sound quality upgrade and a microphone.So the bottom line is- if you have no money to waste and don't want microphone go for cx 180 closing the both eyes. Get a good Equalizer and your base problem will be compensated.

Good earphones with good sound and bass quality and clear sound but a lot of improvement needed with wire quality and material ...As they provided warranty of 2 years...It's more than enough ... One of the plus point to buy this earphone...And price is lil bit high.. if they provide this earphone with mic ...then the price is right...As i see sometimes in lightning deal, the price dropped for this earphone ...So it's good to buy in lightning deal...And the L-shaped earphone jack is tough..Buds are good...Noise cancellation is not bad type...

We all know what is Sennheiser Signature sound quality. This recently launched cx 120bt is no exception.Note: It is not for those who wants only bass because as advertised it has balanced sound signature. You can hear each & every detail of music. The clarity of sound is awesome. Bass is perfect, not overwhelming, precise Mid & creamy Treble. The soundstage is so beautiful.Note: If you want true performance from this earphone please use good music player with manual equaliser. After using manual equaliser the bass will thumping & the mid & treble will more pronounced.Battery backup as advertised 6hrs in normal volume. No ornaments like IPX rating or magnetic buds. Call clarity good if use hd calls moderate on normal calls & no background noise cancellation while calling.Music tested on 1: Poweramp music player with manual equaliser2: Dolby Atmos with manual equaliser3: Poweramp with Dolby Atmos superimposed.4: Sony hi-res music player.

tilte: Must Buy for all the Music Lovers ! Amazing Product
review_body: Very good product with great music output quality and it works amazing. All that I can say that it worthy to invest in this product. Product material quality is durable and good for a long term usage.This ear phones are in ear which helps in noise cancellation. These ear phones are only for listening purpose but cannot be used for taking calls, it does not comes with in bulit Mic but it is worthy to invest in a quality product.

I am putting this review after a 6 month usage period.Price paid for these earphones include to some extent the cost of buying a 'Senheiser' earphone. By that i mean that any other brand would give you this quality at anything around 700 to a thousand.Sound quality is something that senheiser has always maintained even in it's cheapest of products, but unfortunately not in this case. The sound quality is average and doesn't give the senheiser feel. Also no bass.Headphone aren't that comfortable and one can feel slight distress and pain if used for long hours. The design isn't ergonomic, but the noise cancellation is superb. That enhances the overall sound quality of the earphone.Cables are normal and so is the jack. The earphone comes with a spare angled jack which can be used as an adaptor. But using the adaptor jack has a drastic impact on the sound quality and the sound gets torned. So basically it's of no use.The strength of the wire is good. But the life span is yet to be tested.Overall it's an average earphone and doesn't deserve the price it demands. I would rather sugget you to go for hd earphones if you are willing to pay this range of price.

tilte: Sennheiser MX-180 is NOT good but Sennheiser MX-170 is GREAT

Even my old java phone ear phone is better than this MX-180. I feel that i wasted my money.  I noted that, Sennheiser MX 170 Wired Headphone has DUAL layers of wire, whereas, this Sennheiser MX 180 is single layer only. However, it works (i.e) Playing Sound both computer / mobile but NOT giving pleasant like Senneiser MX-170.

tilte: Really overpriced for a substandard quality earbud, that too from Sennheiser !

I became a fan of what i had earlier and thought Sennheiser would have improved the model as this one was priced higher, but to my great disappointment... the grip is bad, cable is really cheap quality, noise isolation - almost nil and finally audio quality, less than average... i have bought a JBL for my daughter at half this price... would not recommend.

tilte: This is my 3rd Sennheiser CX180 Street 2
review_body: This is my 3rd Sennheiser CX180 Street 2 Headphone, I am very use to it and i dont want to listen on any other headphones till now it is Extremely Light and Comfortable to wear I am saying Again Extremely Comfortable and Light the sound quality is excellent Bass is Supreme as well as Noise Cancellation too.Trust me guys its worth every penny the only feature missing is the Mic but that's not a Deal Breaker, most important your ears want Protection of harsh sound and this one is doing very greatly what more to say now Go Buy it without thinking much You wont regret it.

tilte: Best headset at this price point
review_body: I am a music lover and used lot of headphones..This is beyond the expectations..Using it from past 1 year..Till now there is no problem..I use it too rough..soaked in water and rain  and threw here and there still they function good..Sound quality is exceptional at this price point..Only con is no mic..Still I would recommend this for its bass and excellent noise cancellation..Worth the price and you would enjoy music with this headset..Best when compared to other brands at this price point both ob quality and also warranty 2years..cheers!

tilte: So fragile but Sooooo Good. Excellent√®!!
review_body: This is exactly what I needed. I preferred them especially for the bud shape they have & I was pretty much confident that these earphones will  be perfectly suitable for my ears because it is all a matter of perfect fit in the ears to be able to experience that "perfect bass and sound quality"(even mentioned on their packaging as well). I have boat 225 earphones since two years which also have similar shaped but slightly long earbuds due to which they were uncomfortable. I didn't realised it until I got them & instantly regretted. They are still performing great btw. (I pesonally, never liked other "angled" bud earphones). Also, for online study purposes, I needed some comfy earphones for long durations. I wishlisted Sennheiser CX 180 a while ago, but now I preferred the mic version i.e. CX 275s instead. Also, I heard that CX 180 has more treble than CX 275s & some positive reviews about sound quality added cherry on the cake. So, I have a constant watch on CX 275s for a good deal, & finally purchased them for ‚Çπ1599/-. It's only two days & I am already loving them & feeling quite addicted to them.Although they are fragile, they are in my extremely caring hands, & backed up by Sennheiser's 2 year warranty.And as always, thank you Amazon for your excellent services & offers.Cheers!!üëçüíê

I'm kind of a nerd, and I've tried most earphones in this entry-level price range.My favorites are the Sennheiser CX180 and the Audio Technica ATH-CLR100.Now, if the Audio Technica earphones were physically more durable I would pick those because I'm more concerned with the Trebble and Mid frequencies (courtesy of the type of music I listen to).But most people enjoy a 'Bright Bassy' or V-shaped sound signature. That combined with the fact that the Sennheiser earphone has better build quality means that this will be my recommendation.Do keep in mind that this doesn't contain a microphone (The Audio Technica CLR100 has a version with mic).

We can compromise with the button but not with mike.And now coming to the music quality i should say that i was expecting more fron this earphone because my last eaprhone was Flipkart smartbuy bluetooth headset and i purchased it for 699INR and its music quality (if bass is ignored) was very close to this earphone and it had mid-botton,volume buttton and of course a mike and if i include bass then to be honest flipkart smartbuy is  way better than this sennheisser.But i still bought sennheisser because of the 2-years warranty and i read that their service is good(flipkart smartbuy' service was horrible) and i'm happy with my decision.

tilte: My quest for perfection stopped here.‚ô•Ô∏è
review_body: I am an audiophile and so the quality and clarity matters to me a lot. Used jbl c100si , boat 172, ant w56, cx 213 and currently using 180. Go for boat if you want just build and looks, else everything is crap. Jbls had good clarity but lil bass and no stereo effect. Ant has an explosive bass, highs are good and mids are okay. Cx 213 has lil extra bass than 180 but vocals are not as good as 180 due to bass. And also the bass in 180 was very soothing than 213, which tends to overpower other frequencies.Conclusion : if you just want bass with satisfactory vocals and highs and great build, go for ant w56.. Been 8 months and still going well.And if you want to enjoy every minute details in the music cx 180 has no match.I personally use ant w56 for mic and rough use and bass heavy music. But in the night I'm in different world with 180. Very soothing bass with clarity at it's best.

I bought sennheiser cx180 after reading many positive reviews. But what I felt is this earphone is not that good for these much positive reviews & ratings.Earlier I was using soundmagic es18. This was too good but due to my carelessness, it was damaged. So when I was about to order soundmagic es18 again,  it was unavailable.  So I searched for another & sennheiser cx180 came through.Comparing sennheiser cx180 with Soundmagic es18, I felt :-1) Sound is not clear in sennheiser cx180. But in soundmagic, it's more clear.2)Bass is on the higher side in sennheiser cx180 eventhough i adjusted my phone equaliser to the minimum. Now I can't reduce the bass as it's on the lowest setting. But bass is ok for this budget. But the prob is its on the higher side. Some songs are irritating me as I can't reduce the bass.3) Treble is ok. Can be adjusted with the equaliser.4) wire quality is gud. I'm writing this review after 3 months use. So,  I hav no probs with the wire quality.So in short, I think soundmagic is better compared to sennheiser cx180.& I feel Sennheiser cx180 is overrated.

tilte: They are great sounding but sensitive!..
review_body: I have been using these for almost 6  months.I am gonna say that the sound quality of these still surprises me.This earphone has got the sound quality you need. I am gonna list the pros and cons of these for the sake of comprehension.PROS:1. Great design2. The tips provided with these are very soft and comfortable, so you don't get tired of these after long sessions.3. The sound quality is off the charts for the amount of price is paid.4. This is a very great balanced earphone. BASS and TREBLE are balanced efficiently so sounds are not muffled.5. A leather pouch is included in the box for carrying these babies.6. mic quality is very great too.7. The distortion of sound at high levels is surprisingly much less.8. They are much loud and the loudest levels don't lose clarity.9. An L-shaped adapter is provided in the box to use with smartphones and laptops.10. 2-years warranty and the service is very good.CONS:1. They are very sensitive. So you have to take care of them and not use them roughly or they will break.2. (only if you like BASS heavy music.) these aren't BASSHEADS so bass is balanced with treble, thus bass is not  heavy but it sounds better when it's not heavy.3. The connector at the end can break easily with rough usage so I advise you to use the L-shaped  connector/adapter provided in the case with smartphones and laptops(if you use it on your lap.)

tilte: One of the product I've been ever purchase from Amazon‚Ä¶
review_body: I'm using this product from last year and still it's best. No doubt Sennheiser cx180 goes ahead of all other products available on Amazon. Best sound, lite weight only downside is their is no microphone and the wire is so thin that it could be break very easily. But, this one is best or we can say better than all other products.

tilte: Familiar Sennheiser sound. Mid is okis, added bass. I wanted sometnig better on high range but no.
review_body: If you had been using Sennheiser, you will immediately become familiar with the sound. It's ok for the price but of course won't entertain a bass lover.Highs could have been much better. I think cx275s does things better. Mid is interesting, may be the focus is more into mid and lows than highs. I have been using ranges of Sennheiser, Beyerdynamic and Audio Technica, this one dose not give the feel of smooth sound (well this my be too much of expectations for the price). However it does have the bass punch, lil bit of pop up mid but did not adhere to the experience of cx275s.Finally if you are not a bass lover then this one is a good option for the price rather going towards boat, sony and what not. I am not sure about the mic etc. and don't much care about it. It works I am happy. Build quality ehhh! I'm not sure.

Build: not so good.. wires are really flimsy.. light weight this can be both good and bad, bad because feels cheap, good because can wear for long period over all 4/10.sound quality: Clarity is good enough in the price segment, bass is good, mids and highs are also well pronounced.Noise Isolation: Spot on.Comparing with JBL T290: JBL bit less louder though, clarity a lot better here. mids and highs are badly pronounced in JBL. JBL though was better in build quality.Comparing with CX180: same wire quality.(bad), sound quality is lot improved here but a little bit louder than CX180.(CX180>CX275s)Overall if you can take good care of the headphones then the sound quality in the price is perfect.

These are one of the best earphones in these price range. These are better than boat bassheads. tilte: Best of the best.. A Music lover's paradise!! That's Cx180 for you.
review_body: You already know it's the Best. No comparison with any other brands or any product. I love cx180.One important thing is that you don't get a microphone in Cx180. tilte: Good sound and build quality. Excellent value for money. Basically, it's a Sennheiser.
review_body: Sennheiser always has better sound quality than comparable products from other brands like JBL or SkullCandy. I still swear by the Sennheiser CX-180 Street II as the best value for money, but I needed earphones with a microphone for my commute. I've been using these for over 10 months now. Despite looking delicate, they are well built and my earphones have survived daily commutes in Mumbai locals and metro during rush hour (that's saying something) without any damage so far. The sound quality is very good for the price and the bass response is decent (doesn't sound muddy or overpowered). Unlike JBL earphones which I find sound faint even at full volume, I've never had to go over 70% volume with these earphones. They come with a small pouch which is handy. While I prefer the right-angled 3.5mm jack on the CX-180 Street II, the straight jack on these is going string and the wire hasn't broken or shown signs of tear so far. For a great sounding pair of earphones with mic that doesn't break the bank, look no further.

tilte: Good music Quality, but life of earphones is short.
review_body: Bought these earphones at the end of September 2019. These earphones have good sound output with decent base. Mother of God, these earphones are awesome.Just got them barely an hour ago so I'll update if one or both the ears fail in the future.But the quality, oh my god, it's like audible chocolate. The bass, volume, clarity, treble everything is simply perfect. Not too high, not too low. Just Perfect.I don't really care for microphone, but goddamnit I wanted the damn play/pause button. I'll try to find some app that will let me map the volume buttons for play/pause/previous/next.The build quality leaves a lot to be desired, just taking them out of the packaging box felt terrifying because the wires were so tightly clamped, and the less said about material the better.And well, 699 is not cheap, at least it's not to me.Actually not that I see it, it has a lot of cons.But then again, if Sennheiser made perfect headphones that would never break, then no one would actualy buy their other more costly products, or buy the same earphones again, now will they?Huh, I guess that's why phones still aren't waterproof even though water repelling technology has progressed so much in the last few decades.

So here is the detailed review.I bought these on feb on a sale from amazon. I was excited since this was my first time to use any Sennheiser product. They worked super fine on the starting weeks. But now in the month of june they just stopped working like they used to. sound quality dropped by leaps and bounds. I can't even hear properly what's the person is saying in any YouTube video. Have to put on captions.  They do give great costumer services but now in lockdown... Everything is changed.The nearest centre from my home is one in mumbai. It remains closed due to the pandemic. I tried calling the one in kolkata, they didn't picked any of my call.Pros :sound is too good. More sound when compared to other earphones in the similar price range.Noise cancellation is pretty good.L shaped lead. Love this design. Will help you avoiding wire break located close to the lead. Also it's comfortable when playing pubg or any other game. It doesn't hinders your finger movements.Cons :Built quality is okay. They say it's tangle free but it gets tangled easily.Keep in mind that there's no mic. I once attended an online meeting and they couldn't hear me properly.Ear comfort is problematic. You'll have to push earphones into your ears often since they fall out easily.Bass is low. Yes! I've been using jbl cs 100 which costs a little more than these but the output of them is super. The bass in these is low when compared to jbl.Conclusion : They do give 2 years warranty but you have to look properly. See! There are only 4 centres of Sennheiser so replacement can be a problem especially when you are stuck like me because of the lockdown. I'll suggest you to go with JBL. The warranty is one year but you'll be much more satisfied. This is the last time I'll be using these Sennheiser earphones. I won't recommend to any of my friends since my experience wasn't too good. No mic, less bass, poor quality, service centre problems, no response on call, made me to switch back to JBL again.Hope this will be helpful to you and you'll be able to make decision.Have a nice day!!‚ú®

Overall, these are a good bunch of headphones!

tilte: More of a V sound signature. Has cable noise.

This sometimes becomes disturbing when there are ssss es in the vocals or the hithats are being struck.Plus, the product is under 10 days replacement now, meaning if you are dissatisfied, you can ask for a replacement and the same thing will be sent to you. You CANNOT exchange it for amazon pay balance or a refund in your bank a/c.The GOOD part which made me smile:The earpieces are really tiny and you can sleep ear down and it wont be a discomfort. tilte: Sennheiser CX-180 Ear Canal Headphones that provides you well-balanced and high resolution sound.
review_body: Talking about Performance this In-Ear Headphone, It is Delivering unrivaled bass, these Sennheiser ear canal headphones provide you well-balanced and high resolution sound. Besides this, these Sennheiser ear canal headphones help to minimize the ambient noise for an enriched listening experience.FOR FULL REVIEW & UNBOXING SEARCH ( BACKSPACE PRO ) ON YOUTUBE.Now lets talk about Design & Comfort Sennhiser CX 180 (Street-2) In-Ear Headphone is Sporting a finger contoured housing design, these Sennheiser headphones are extremely comfortable to wear and can be easily adjusted to fit into the ear canal comfortably over all Compatibility of Sennhiser CX 180, These ear canal headphones come with a 3.5 mm plug, making it compatible with most devices like MP3's and handsets.WHAT I THINK ABOUT SENNHISER CX 180.Since I was looking for a pair of In-Ear Canal-phone (referred to as Earphones hereafter), I had short-listed these from Sennheiser. I already have a Sennheiser HD 202 II to use at home (The cord is over 2.00 Mtrs. in Length, hence its not that handy outside, but the quality is phenomenal.) and I snapped my long serving Skullcandy S2DUDZ-003 Headphones, I was looking out for new ones.DESIGN:The design of the earphones is brilliant with the way you ergonomically hold up the earphone and insert it in your ear-canal, each element has been worked upon and well design. The cord though long, seems fragile, I am concerned about this especially because I am person who will use it in a excessively rough manner. Will be able to comment on the same after some months of rough use.SOUND QUALITY:I always purchase Sennheiser Earphones or Headphones because I love the Clarity of Sound, and I'm happy with my purchase. The Vocals are very pure and clear, treble is great, bass is perfect for my preference and not to overpowering. Listening to all Genres of Music is enjoyable.MY FINAL VERDICT:If your looking for durable In-Ear-Canal phones for standard use on the go, please considered this, since even at an MRP of Rs.990.00 they are worth the money you put in for casual listening and I assure you, that you wont be disappointed with the quality of Sound!!I Hope My Review Will Help You,  Subscribe the Channel Backspace Pro.

Noise cancellation is also excellent, as it cancels out majority of external noise.Only downside is the wire is a flimsy. But even though it's been through some abuse there's not a scratch. To conclude I'd say this is an excellent purchase and it's definitely worth the money.

review_body: This earphones is downright ridiculuous - in the quest to boost the bass, rest of the frequency bands have been sacrificed. Especially noticeable is the poor rendering of vocals, it sounds like you are listening to a singer stuck down inside a well.

tilte: Best sound quality, poor wire material
review_body: I am a genuine buyer of Sennheiser CX180 earphones and I am writing this feedback after 11 months of usage of this product.Following are the pros and cons of this product.Pros1. Best sound quality compared to other brands of its class.2. Good bass quality.3. 2 Years manufacturer warrantyCons1. The wire quality of earphones is very poor. Despite careful usage the wires being so thin start getting cut within 6 months due to wear and tear.2. The wires are not tangle free. Sennheiser can use better quality tangle free wire just like in Boat earphones for which they may charge few Rupees extra.3. The warranty of 2 years does not cover the damage due to wear and tear or accidents which are the main reasons for discarding the earphones. Hence the 2 year warranty policy is more of a marketing gimmick with almost no practical application.4. No mic. Hence cannot be used for calls. Especially required during long telephonic conversation.5. Relatively expensive. Brands like Boat offer good quality earphones at relatively cheaper price with features like mic, tangle free durable wire hence offering better value for money.

tilte: So far so good. Comparison to JBl headphone.
review_body: Review after 2 months of use. Had a JBL headphone earlier hence comparing to it. The sound is better than JBL. But the price is too. JBL after discount was around 800. Sennheiser after discount was around 1300. Can't see the vast difference in sound quality. Might be 10% better than JBL. It's been 3 months but no damage yet. Myself being a very rough & constant user. JBL lasted for about 8months and sound stopped in one ear due time bending of joint on top of the 3.5mm pin.

tilte: Good sound quality, product & wire feel delicate
review_body: If this were to be rated solely on basis of quality of sound, it would receive 5 stars hands down.However, the material quality leave a lot to be desired. Wires are thin and feel very delicate and makes me worried that they would break / tear one of these days. headphones do not have magnets that sticks two earpieces together. this is not a must have feature but would be good to have, esp considering the price point.

tilte: 2yrs 11mnths going on working all good, truly this brand needs no promotion
review_body: I have never posted review for any stuff I bought, this is for the 1st time I dedicated time to post this, because I feel proud to have such a masterpiece which is highly rated and recommended in music industry.Sennheiser Cx180 Street 2 earphone is one of the best when it comes to sound quality and durability.  Bass and Treble are on little high and balancing Mid overall professional  audio quality, if you are new to earphones and you are okay with no microphone consider this as your first purchase and you won't regret it.I purchased this on November 2016 and it's been 2years & 11months and only the logo of Sennheiser which was glued lost plus some twists in wire near the housing both left and right, little of grey covering came out near the housing, due to continuous usage in sweaty environment (like Jogging) but still working excellent like new one.It's noise cancellation is heavy, Warning don't wear this while walking on a busy road. You won't even get a honk behind you when the volume is little more (3 presses more than medium).The perfect bass that everyone will love to enjoy to the rhythm of the song be it pop, hip-hop or rock you will end up banging head feeling the clear beats.Enclosing some pics taken on 2nd October 2019.

tilte: Good sound quality, however not very convenient
review_body: No doubt it has great sound quality. However, there many other disadvantages that will make me stop from using them soon.1. The noise cancellation has a side effect. It gives a feeling of your ear being closed like you feel when flights land. This is counter productive as I use it for my work calls on laptop and constantly feel this is very annoying2. Wire is thin and gets tangled easily. It takes some time n effort to untangle each day3. They don't stick around very week. Slightest of pull and these come off easily. I have been used to of Bose Soundsport in-ear for last 4 years, and clearly I will have to go back to them. Unfortunately, Bose have discontinued those.Giving 3 star as sound quality is as promised.

I loved my Sennheiser CX 275 S, it was a blend of everything we wanted from a pair of Earphones.I used mine for roughly 4-5 months and it worked fine, until it broke suddenly.If you are going to buy these earphones, remember, it cannot be rough handled, it can cut if even a little pressure/force is exerted on it.I had my pair plugged into my phone, and when I stood up, the wire got caught up to a switch or something, because of this, the wire snapped, leaving the pin still in my phone.So like this, small amounts of force/pressure too can damage the earphones.Otherwise, the audio output is good, the design looks good, but the durability is not up to the mark.

I am not an audiophile so i will not go into the details about highs, mids and lows but this is the best music experience I've had with a headphone so far. Far better than any skullcandys in the range.As a non-audiophile i felt the music was full and rich. There is not too much bass but will produce only as much bass as present in the audio file. Personally I don't like overpowered bass.The finger grove design makes it easy for you to adjust placement of the bud in the ear.The cable length and quality is perfect not to mention the 2-years warranty which makes this a solid buy. The cable is not tangle free but will not give you a hard time untangling it.Defenitely worth the buy if you get a good deal.

tilte: Size of pods and tips just right for small ear
review_body: PS: This review is post 3 days of use.I'm a habitual loser of earphones and have cycled through so many in ear earphones by now that its crazy. Up until these headphones I was mystified how anyone found in-ear headphones comfortable. I could never listen to anything for over 30-40 mins from such earphones. I realized I have earlobes which are probably on the smaller side and typical apple earpods or other earpods with rubber tips were just too big for my ear which caused the discomfort. It's not just that the tips of the pods are right size but the pods themselves are also on the smaller side and fit very snugly in the cave of the ear. They dont slide out even when your head is on pillow or a headrest. The sound quality is unbeatable for the price. The product fits well for people with following requirements:1) Not too pricey but pretty decent quality.2) Good fit for smaller earlobes/ears.3) Travel friendly as you dont need special cases. Its a standard earphone. Just grab, fold, dump and go. Although I havent faced any problem so far but the wires seem a little less durable. For longer vacations I use over the phones that are a lot more comfortable and have better noise cancellation.4) This is important - THERE IS NO MIC. So if you are ok using phone speaker while taking calls, you are peach. My calls typically last a max of 3-5 mins

I am not here to review the product but overall the Sennheiser CX 180 Street II headset is awesome at this price range. Today I am here to tell you about my experience with Sennheiser Service. I brought the product about 11 months ago on Oct'18, but recently I faced issues regarding the headset. The right side earpiece sound dramatically goes low & I decided to claim Service request from Sennheiser. I am from Assam & there is no service centre near my location & actually all over India there is only 4 Service Centre available. The closest one is in Kolkata so I decided to call Sennheiser Service toll free no. & discuss about the matter. They told me not to send the headset to Kolkata Office as they do not have Courier facility to send the product back to you after repairing. They told me to send the product to Haryana office (Gurugram) with the box and all original accessories and Original Invoice. They also told me to write down my informations such as name, ph no, email id, & address in a paper & send it inside the box. I send the package & it took me just 8 days to get my product back from them & guess what I recieved a brand new Sennheiser CX180 headset. It put a nice smile on my face. I am very impressed with the Sennheiser Service, I recommend to go for their products & as everyone knows they are king in audio device making all over the world. Hope this will help you guys, Peace!

tilte: Best if you don't need mic.
review_body: I have used this product for the last two years before one side earphone speaker stopped working. But it is very good for my usage so I just ordered another today.Your use case and design preferences may vary from mine so this review may not be relevant for you.Most important con: Microphone not available!But if you can live without that I can say nothing comes closer to perfect sound quality at this price point of 700 Rupees.Build quality is not that good.You do not get braided cables so forget about that spring like connector protection as well. What you get is very lightweight eartips (comfortable) with thin rubbery wires and a right angle connector (which I personally prefer). Yes you get extra eartips for all three sizes so it wont matter if you lost the default ones.If you do not take care of this earphone, it will not survive more than a year. Mine lasted 2 years and a month with average usage.The bass of this earphone is good enough (personal opinion of course).It is not excessive like some other brands that claim having Extra Bass or Deep Bass. So you get an optimal sound experience.And yes please stay away from this if you like Boomy Bass. You can buy those cheap local earphones that blow away your ears because this one will not do that.Overall, this comes very close to what sennheiser tries to do that is pure sound experience. Butat this price point this earphone will not feel like a true sennheiser product. Sennheiser's actual sound tuning and experience is for audiophiles and cost very much. But anyways I will always go for this product since my budget is tight.

tilte: Better then Sony Xtra base series.
review_body: I have been using the Sony Xtra base series from the past 6 years. My average daily music consume is more than 6 hours. I don't have much knowledge about audio but trust me switching to Sennheiser CX 275 S was a great experience. The sound is great and feels clear. I am comparing it with Sony.- Sony. The base is high, a good choice.. Not so durable almost lost all earphones after 1 year. They work fine until the warranty is valid. Although the build is tangle free and feels sturdy.- Sennheiser. This was a surprise. The base is there as needed. Sound balance is top-notch. I became a big fan.. Best choice under 1.5K. The mic is good quality and the person on the other side gets a loud and clear sound.. This is better than CX 180. I am happy to pay almost 800 RS extra for better sound and mic experience.. Comes with 2 years warranty. This is just wow. I have friends who got it replaced and got a brand new even in there last month of warranty.Advice:If your budget is less then 3K. Close your eyes buy this. Even in 2020, this is the best option. Don't buy TWS or Bluetooths once they are just show off and sounds crap.If you don't have a 3.5mm hole in the phone then the other best option can be oppo Enco M31 under 3K. But trust me guys if you have that option to use wired once this is what you need. Hope to found this helpful. :)

1) Have heard enough about the Sennheiser CX180 so i had ordered it, even though i have already a new Mi dual driver earphone..so after using it i found it has good vocal, good bass but treble(highs) are little bit over powered so sometimes its noisy and due to over powered treble( almost 10 to 20 percent) the crystal clearness of sound is turned into noise and then its no more pleasant for ear....believe me guys Mi dual driver are very crystal clear and not noisy although in Mi dual driver earphone vocals are little bit suppressed ( 10 to 15% ) cuz its a V sound signature earphone but with a little setting by equiliser for the vocals it provides very good and better sound than Sennheiser...( "Nami Baniya pakwaan feeka" suna tha aaj dekh bhi liya...Sennheiser is just Nami Baniya)2) company is spending more on packing cover than the wires used in the earphone..lolz..i mean look at the the packing and the wire quality, only either a fool can do this or a company can do this which values its branding and attractiveness but doesn't think about the durability of the product..ofcourse company is giving replacement guarantee but that doesn't mean to compromise with the quality and durability.3) i dont think that adding a mic would cost so much tha company could not made it even after fixing its price above 600 rupees...Some companies are good looter.

Jst that they didnt have a mic so I got these. They are very comfortable and sound quality is great, balanced. Only the cable is too thin, looks fragile it was like that on CX180 too and nothing happened to that so i dont think it will be a problem.I ordered one and after using for a day i realized the mic wasnt working properly and the button also didnt respond sometimes, but i got it replaced and now no issue with it. :)

tilte: Review after two years. Great earphone but not for rough use
review_body: prior to this earphones i have used JBLT150A, Sony MDR-EX150AP, Sennheiser CX 180  all of them were good products which lasted 2 years  except JBLT150 which i had to replace after 6 months. i tested Sennheiser CX 275 when my friend bought it and i knew which earphone would be my next daily driver. Its audio quality was great in all freq ranges whether its low, high or mid it was engineered perfectly. biggest con of the earphone is its build quality the wires are too thin and could be damaged easily for a rough user it will brake easily(for such user i would suggest to go for something with kevlar,flat or braided wires ) i consider myself a rough user i would fell asleep with my earphones plugged in to either phone or my laptop. it finally took a toll on it. it started tearing of on joints and and other parts were it usually bend or gets tangled today its left driver stopped working due to damage on the wire. it  worked perfectly fine for 2years which is great considering its thin wires.

I have been using this particular earphones from the last 1 year and it is working great. So I decided to buy another for my father. But I guess that was my bad experience as instead of upgrading their product, Sennheiser decided to degrade it.I had a very bad experience. Used hardly a month, and voice from the right side earphone was very low with continuous cracked noise, whereas the left side earphone is working fine.Really disappointed.

I like the sound quality, more neutral, don't expect bass boost from this. Comfort is amazing, I can sleep off while wearing these. Compared to boat basshead, this doesn't fall out of my ears easily while working out / running.Touchwood, this hasn't broken / become lose at any place so far. Glad that it doesn't have volume buttons etc, they usually get wet in sweat and stop functioning. It does okay isolation, nothing like M6 pro.

tilte: From both the look & feel, and the sound quality, did not feel like a genuine Sennheiser
review_body: There was something very off about this item. I have been using the same model since 2018, and ordered this one as a replacement. First off, the cord was much thinner and stiffer and the earbuds were not the usual soft material found in Sennheisers. The jack also was a bit of a pain to insert in the phone, as if it was getting stuck. Never faced that with Sennheisers before. Finally, the sound was way off what Sennheisers are supposed to sound like. Checked the QR Code printed on the package, and just like they tell you in YouTube videos on how to distinguish fakes, there was no serial number printed below the QR Code. The QR Code itself, also, took me to a random website which was too poorly formatted/ coded to look like a genuine Sennheiser website. From both the look & feel, and the sound quality, did not feel like a genuine Sennheiser.

Every one have their own unique taste.And if we tried to prove someone that Sennheiser is the best and it has crystal clear sound, rich in auto quality, balanced bass and treble etc etc... No one will agree other than Sennheiser lovers.In simple one word to say about this product is, If you're an audiophile then go for it with closed eyes... Other neglect this and go for JBL, Sony, Bose, Skullcandy, Ant, Boult, Boat and soo on respectively.

First of all the build quality is awesome the wires are little thin but feels sturdy.SOUND QUALITY -what can I say it's sennheiser the name is enough the sound feels very premium like 2k or 3k earphones. The instrument separation is good u will hear every little beat very easily.Stereo separation is good and high tone and low tones are very accurate.Bass quality is accurate when requires it comes and goes, it's not like cheap boat earphones like overpowering bass.Treble is awesome.Overall this earphone is for music lovers go for it blindly and cherry on the cake is its 2 years warranty and sennheiser customer service is quit good.

I always believe Amazon has best service.Received headset in two days.Packing was perfect & product found to be genuine.Again thanks to Amazon.Pros-1.Design is good & contemporary 2.Ear buds fit very well.3.Sound profile is neutral with slight tilt towards treble. 4. Mids & High are very well separated. Cons-1.Bass fills  less as i am user of sony headsets which are higher on bass.2.Wires are thin & prone to break easily if not handled carefully.3.Mic not tested yet but looks good.Over all it good for listening music & calls.Certainly not for bass lovers as they will be disppointed just like me but i wanted to try something different other than bass heavy sony headsets, so went ahead for this.

While the earphones definitely lack some bass reproduction, the sonic accuracy makes up for it. As someone who listens to classical/orchestra music, this is surprisingly good at reproducing and differentiating the sounds of different instruments. And to top it all off, its got excellent sound pick up with its mic. People who I was talking to could hear sounds more than 10 metres away from me.Lastly, it's a Sennheiser, so it goes without saying that the durability and build quality of the product is best in class. However, if you're a basshead, Sony products do a better job at the same price, but it's still great value for money.P.S: You gotta love that leather pouch that comes with it, that's classy

tilte: Excellent audio quality and noise cancelation but left right polarity is flipped
review_body: Ordered product on early september 2018, delivery was timely as usual. After approximately 6 months of use, here's what I observed.PROS1. Sound quality is really good. Covers frequency ranging from 10 hz. to 15,000 hz. Means, excellent bass, and remarkable treble sounds.2. The mouthpiece, or the mic, is also really good. I have found that the clarity at the other end is pretty good even when I am riding a bike @60kmph, which brings me to another point3. I occasionally listen to songs on this earphone while riding bike, and I have to tell you, noise cancelation is phenomenal.4. Another good thing I noted about this piece is that, while you are on a call and you speak on the mic, the earpiece gives you a feedback of your voice. In other words, you can hear yourself speak on the earpiece, which I found to be an interesting quirk. Reason being, in most of the noise cancelation earphones, you can't hear your voice, except for a deep rumbling on your chest (try speaking with your fingers plugging your ears)CONS1. Well, the wire noise is a bit turn off. Could have been better, but it is not too much to complain about anyway.2. Now this one really gets me. The left and right earpieces are reverse! From a brand like Sennheiser, this simply is negligence. Now, this doesn't make much of difference to someone who does not really care about where the sound is coming from, but for music lover like myself, this is a bummer. Your favorite song does not sound, well, like it should.But then, you can always switch your ears... Put left on right and right on left. That fixes everything, and there is no discomfort in your ears if you do so.But still...Anyway, a 4 star from my side. Fix the left right issue, and its a 5 star product.

tilte: Great Earphones. Great Service. Strongly Recommend.
review_body: I bought these in Jan 2019 so this is a super-late review. But it also means I've used these for over 1.5 years now so it's really a long term use review.Without getting into technical details, they sound great. Sennheiser's earphones are known for being higher on treble and low on bass and these are no different. However, they produce good, strong, clear sound without any tearing and are capable of excellent surround effects with binaural sounds. They also have a great frequency response so you can hear the lows and the highs with equal clarity. I've primarily used these to watch Movies and TV Shows, ocassionally for Gaming and Music and I experienced superior audio in all cases (including 5.1 sound)The best part about Sennheiser though is its service. The earphones stopped working for me after 1.5 years. I took it to Sennheiser's service center. They asked for my contact details, explained the possible reason for the malfunction (apparently, I put too much strain on the connector causing it to internally break leading to audio issues) and promptly replaced it with a new one. That's it. No questions asked, as simple as that.So after a year and a half of use, I still have a brand new pair. Awesome.I do have to say though that the build quality isn't the best so these can last long if you take good care of them (the way you store them, the way you unplug them, etc.). I imagine most people don't which leads to defects. Also, these don't have a microphone built in in case that's a deal-breaker for you.Verdict? If you're someone looking for a pair of earphones under ‚Çπ1,000 that will last long and give you peace of mind, buy this without a doubt. The sound quality is pretty good and Sennheiser's warranty will ensure that you can use it for 2 years without any worries.

tilte: Disappointed and very surprised. A solid 6/10.
review_body: 2020 Update.After delaying this purchase for weeks, I finally went ahead and bought these set of earphones. I was on a tight budget and desperately needed a new pair of earphones but I managed to hold off buying them for a few months and researched as much as I could.I have to admit my disappointment is through the roof.Let's break this down.I was previously using the JBL C100SI and then the Sony MDR - EX150AP. Somewhere in the middle, I also pushed myself to purchase some cheap ones and finally these.1) Overall purchase: 8/10- Shipped on time, convenient delivery and easy navigation on the website.- Great packaging.2) Build: 7/10- Not the most attractive but definitely not disappointing.- Thin wires. High chances of getting tangled.- Comfortable buds, sets inside the ears perfectly. Little to no pain whatsoever. Don't slide off and can be used over long periods of time.- L shaped jack. Low chances of internal wire damage.- No mic, but I was well aware of that before buying as I did not want a mic anyway.3) Sound: 4/10- The mids and highs are alright, nothing too crazy.- Obnoxious treble and a very cheap bass. The bass is almost non existent, actually. So much so, that the earphones they sell on the street for 120 bucks have at least a somewhat smooth sound. Yeah. That bad. I'm talking excruciating banging in your ears and reducing the volume to 60% in order to not lose your hearing. Maybe it's because I'm a psychopath who needs the volume at 100% at all times and you're actually supposed to listen to music at 60-70% in order to experience good bass and overall sound, but hey, it is what it is. If you listen to your music with volume at 100% and expect smooth bass and not a shrill sound that pierces your eardrums, these are so not for you. All the earphones (including the cheap ones) I mentioned above don't do that. Shocking.- Sound/volume distorts above 80% volume. It's painful, it is.- The noise cancellation is pretty great but honestly, not at the cost of your eardrums.Overall: 6/10. And I'm being generous here. No offence.I don't care so much about the build, design, company or even the shipping/delivery if the sound itself is so... excuse my French... bad.I'm gonna be honest here. I don't like to bootlick famous brands or even run after branded things, but I genuinely did not expect this from such a renowned brand. Sennheiser and disappointment are two words I never thought I'd use in the same sentence, but here we are.All in all: The earphones aren't all that bad if you keep your volume at 70% while listening to music and at 85% while watching movies, etc. If you handle them carefully, they will last you a long time and the customer service is brilliant. I'm just surprised that Sennheiser created these. I wouldn't believe you if you told me.And before anyone comes at me, yes the ones I received were genuine and not a fake reproduction.I'm looking forward to less disappointing purchases from Sennheiser in the near future.TL;DR: If you're a bass lover and lisen to music with your volume all the way at 100%, these are definitely not for you. Otherwise, they're alright. Not Sennheiser's best.- A disappointed customer.

tilte: Good headphone from a company that provides great warranty for it.

It offers great value for money and 2-year warranty.Plus, Sennheiser is an excellent company. I used a different Sennheiser headphone, and it was not working after 19 months. The company gives 2 year warranty for headphones. I first contacted the retail store from where I bought it. They told me to come back after a few days. When I revisited them, they told we have send your headphone to Sennheiser. To my surprise, I got a fresh piece from Sennheiser. I feel what they offer is a replacement warranty. When buying from Amazon, do keep the bill and whole package to claim the warranty when required.

Call quality too is good. I've read sennheiser has wonderful customer service, so that shouldn't be a issue. I suggest you buy it on a discount. Bass is not much compared to Sony MDR-XB55AP in-Ear Extra Bass Headphones, and much Better than JBL , boAt and MI earphones.

tilte: Great Headphones with Great after sales service

Belive me i have used 3k-4k headphones.2.Sound Quality : Considerably Good. As I listen Indian Classical music, Jazz and sometimes trending Bollywood music.3. Design : One of the best feature why i brought this again and again, means how many headphone can be use while lying onside on bed with comfert.4. After sales service : Five star service. Company do not ask question. You just need to go or courier them your headphone with invoice and they will just handover you a brand new seal pack headphone. in case of courier it took me 2 days to reach them 1 day to process and after 2 day, i got this. so max one week.Cons:1. No mic : you can have another model for that2. wire quality : can be improve, but on average use it could get damage after 1 and half year and you can claim warrenty means it can last for 3 year.

Its a good quality headset for routine use for the amateur music lover. It may not have the depth or the range for an enthusiast, but is a very good headset for listening to music, movies and the occasional gaming. Fits snugly. Addition of a microphone with this set at this cost would have hit the Bulls eye.

This here is the best of Sennheiser products. It's comfortable. it's got a microphone jack with call answer/pause/play button. It's sleek and easy to carry around. If you use it for at least 2-3 hours per day, every day, these will last 1-2 years depending of the nature of your use. Sometimes, rough handling can cause issues. I had my first pair for 2 years and now, I'm using my second pair..

These are THE best headphones for a price range of 1000.They have really great sound, superb bass.At only 5gms, they're super lightweight.The earpiece is very small and super light, the buds are pretty soft as well, so even after wearing them for hours, they don't feel irritating.The noise cancellation is good because of their design and build itself. Even on lower levels of volume, the cancellation is really good. Even when no audio is playing on them, they provide pretty good noise cancellation.Don't expect the sound quality of a 20K headphones from them. But they are just great for this price range.An additional benefit is that they come with a 2 year replacement warranty, and they don't break that easily; I'm saying cause I literally dance wearing them.They do tangle though.. But that's with almost all the headphones.I have been using them for 4 years now. They're still The Best.

tilte: No-frills headphone that gets the job done

I use it both to listen to music, videos, podcasts etc., and also for making calls.Sound quality is more than satisfactory.Though there's no active noise cancellation or anything, simply plugging it in drowns out quite a lot of background noise.The lack of a mic can be a problem if your primary purpose is to make phone-calls.The headphone seems to be durable -- I have accidentally pulled hard on it a few times, and no, nothing snapped or became loose. I have been using Sennheiser CX 275 S in-ear earphone for over five months. This product rendered really good quality of sound at first but with time, the quality dropped drastically. Senheiser is known for catching the subtle distinctions of each frequency perfectly at a time and giving a harmonious experience while listening. But after the regular use of only four and half months, this very specific characteristic is lost. I made sure that no damage has been caused to the earphone (even though its tangled chord often gives a tough time to handle) due to any mishandling or rough uses. Now a days, the product puts forth almost a monophonic sound. The bass was never really high. And it's ok since I already knew about its bass quality during my purchase. Noise cancelation is up to the modest mark, more or less. But as I stated earlier, the quality dropped for no reason what so ever. I didn't buy an earphone worth double a thousand bucks just to last only for four months. So, I am quite unhappy with this particular product.

If someone who love vocal sound will love these bass is low to keep vocal high and sound quality is good.noise cancellation is good as well the only thing I want that is the wire become tangible and for rough user it can be the issues and durability of wire will be tested.Overall the product is good in this range and sound quality is excellent now it's totally on people on there preferable what kind of earphone they want vocals or high bass.

What can I say! Best sounding earphones I ever used. Sennheiser is god in term of clarity in the audio.People these days are talking about bass all the time and giving uncomfortable muddy bassy sounding earphones 5 stars. Don't know what happened to people nowadays. They are excessively bassy all the time which is not at all good for long time usage and headache inducing. Also the bass comes by sacrificing the overall clarity, instrument separation and good overall sound. Which is an absolutely no no for me.  Sennheiser cx180 does have bass when needed, and very sufficiently so. It just comes and goes like magic.I have previously used Sennheiser MX 170, a long ago in my teenage which just surprised me that this audio quality is also reality. Though they don't have rubber buds and very uncomfortable for me, so I switched to senneheiser cx180. After that I used Sennheiser cx213 which was also very good but I preferred cx180. After that I used a lot of other brands' earphones, like :Boat (totally uncomfortable and overall bad sound quality),JBL c100si and c150si (both same. good but not as much as this one, cx180 has much more clearer sound. Also Jbls have more bulk than cx180),Realme buds (good enough for bassy music overall, but muddy mid and treble. comfortable enough),Audio Technica clr100 (good clarity, though not as clear as cx180 but lacks bass very much which cx180 doesn't) etc. Then I came back to cx180 again. Because it is true love. I cannot praise it enough.This earphone sounds like heaven to me. The clarity and richness of the sound is incomparable in this price point. They are so lightweight, small and comfortable that I don't even realize that I'm wearing them.Yes just like all the good things come at a cost, it also has a con, which is it doesn't have a mic. Very big bummer to a totally perfect earphone. But I don't mind the sound quality makes up for it for me. I use jbl for phone calls :vIf sound quality is your priority, just get it already and you will know what I'm talking about. ü§ò

tilte: Best Neutral Sounding Earphone in This Segment
review_body: While most lf the people think Sennheiser cx180 is overrated IMHO it is one of the best earphones in this segment, I have used jbl, boAt earphones within this segment but these sound best among them, fits better than those and are lighter in weight than those earphones.Also before buying these earphone I thought about those delicate cable but even after 6 months of use cable is in good condition despite of the rough usage.And it comes with 2 years of warranty.PSA Bassheads stay away from these as these will not suit you.

I'm writing this review after about 6 months of use.Material quality:The build quality of this product isn't on par with with some other products at this price range as the wires are thin and unbraided which often causes them to get entangled pretty easily.Durability:After 6 months there is normal wear and tear which also depends upon individual use but they are working just fine.Sound quality:The most important one for most of us,so the sound quality is what made me fall in love with these earphones.They're just perfect for my taste as the bass isn't that intense and the mids and lows are just on spot.To sum up:It's a pretty decent pair of earphones for their price with great sound and average build quality.I say go for it.Ps: if you are confused between jbl's earphones and this one,just go for these as they sound much better

tilte: Sennheiser has watered down the quality on these!
