I love Sennheiser.I lost my cx 180 and they are also my darlings, i used them for more than 1 year and 6 months.Then I hit purchase for this for bringing a next level to my music hearing and quality of sound  that sennheiser earphones provides and known for as compare to other audiotechninca, skullcandy, jbl and etc.Its been more then three weeks am using this product, it really feels comfortable to ear even being in ear earphones.Prons:- You can even hear every synth and kicks, I mean every pinch of musical instruments used in that particular song- I played a low bit rate audio and I can even heard those buzzes and cracks in songs which is quite impressive.- The noise cancellation is really impressive when music is turned on.- The huge plus point is Mic.- The voice quality of mic even in heavy traffic is really impressive, it do comes with noise cancellation over the mic, which impressed me a lot.-  I am a PUBG player, and for gaming, these will be your DARLO.... you can even hear a snake person moving in PUBG either he is on left or right or at middle, you can notice them.- Do comes with a leather pouch with Sennheiser Logo on it, which makes it more premium.Cons:A bit expensive, but you can get better deals on Big Day Sale or Diwali Sale and save upto 200 - 300rs on these, as i purchased these for 1749rs, because am a Sennheiser lover.. .

The earphone looks thin, but I have used it for more than 1.5 years and I have ordered another set. For the these years I have tested everything with this earphone. They don't have that fake and extra heavy bass but everything is so balanced that you won't hurt your ears after hours of listening to music. I am a metalhead and listen to all sorts of music from rock ballads to progressive metal music. This one is sturdy, gives the nicest of sound in its range and the second to none service from Senheiser gives you 2 years of hassle free replacement warranty. If something goes wrong just put it in a packet and put your address along with your invoice and they'll replace it within 7 days of your courier reaching them. I have also used set of JBL earphones also and trust me they stand nowhere infront of their quality and service.

I'm using these earphones from more than a year now. These are really good earphones sound wise , its bass and noise cancellation quality are also good but build quality is very poor as comapred to other variants like CX-180. Its cable is so thin that it may break anytime. Also there is tangling problem in cable much more than usual earphones. Its headphone jack doesn't fit every mobile device correctly and stop working within 3-4 months for sure. Other than that, one side of earphones will stop working in 3-4 months. Mic quality is very nice, I've used it for recording videos also. These earphones are only great because of their warranty period of two years, so you can exchange them anytime even via courier.

I would recommend this product to everyone who are on budget below 1000rs. This is literally the best product you can get in this range if your priority is music quality above all. I am personally using this product for about 3 years now and this had been the best companion of mine since then, may it be long traveling or just chilling on your bed. I love this product due to several reasons and I would like to state some of them.- I particularly like the balance between the bass and tremble that this product maintains as it offers crisp music quality and brings out the minute details off the song.therefore it doesn't matter if you listen to nucleya or kishore kumar!!. You'll get the best out of both. So it's a 10 on 10 for music quality.- It's perfect for any ears as it fits in smoothly and gives an immerse listening experience for a long period of time. I used it many time for my 6-7 hours long traveling so I strongly recommend for people who travel more and ones who like to sleep while listening to music.- One of the most important factor that generally people don't see while they purchase earphones is customer service and warranty. This earphones comes with 2 years warranty. After using it for about one and a half year suddenly my right earpiece stopped working , I sent it to my nearest service centre and within 20 days I got brand new ones. Really cool right!!- I must tell you that this provides decent noise cancellation, for the price I think it's great. Also it's not bass heavy so if you are strictly into EDM you might not like it. But if you're flexible with music and like to listen to wide range of music genres this earphones are definitely the one for you guys.- One of the major disadvantages that this earphone has is that it doesn't have microphone so if you talk a lot over the phone simply DON'T buy these. Tangleness is not much of an issue. Other than this These earphones are the best you can get.I hope you will find this review usefull :)

Crystal clear sound with distinct mids, highs and lows. For those saying that these lacks bass, it doesn't at all in my opinion. Rather, it's good in that aspect instead of bass being all over the place like many extra bass earphones that are available at this price. These pair of headphones should be given some time to burn it after purchase. Noise cancelling is really good and ear plugs are very comfortable for long duration. However, it needs to be mentioned that these have a delicate build and feel, and looks cheap considering other products at this price, most of which have a much better build. Wires are thin and prone to tangle. Not recommend for rough use. But as far as quality of sound goes, it's one of the best if not the best at this range of price(1-2k). Great product(except build quality) at this price and the 2 year warranty that comes with it makes it more so.

tilte: Go For it.!..but.....a few things to remember....!

I have been using these earphones for more than 2 years now. So i am well qualified to review these earphones.Talking of any earphones I feel there will be 4 characteristics that are to be discussed to make a decision whether to go for them or not. So here we go:1) sound quality: Hailing from a reputed brand these earphones deliver amazing sound. I have used a lot of earphones but none can match these. I can say these are the best wired earphones in a budget of <3k. Yes, I personally felt even the overpriced earphones from Sony or jbl cant match these earphones in any aspect.2) Design & build quality: These earphones have a minimalistic design. They are very light in weight and the material used looks like plastic but is of very high quality. The cable is of very good quality and flexible.Believe me I have used these earphones for more than 2 years now and they still look like new ones.3) Durability: As I said they are made of high quality material and must easily give a life of more than 2 years.(even the warranty period is 2 yrs).4) pricing: Coming to pricing I will have to choose some of competitors to evaluate its value. As of now we have boat, Sony, jbl and skull candy as it's competitors with a couple of their products priced in and around 500-2k INR.I have used all of these brands and I personally feel they are no where in competition with senheisser. I have used boat rockerz(<649INR), they felt good initially but are not durable like these. Coming to skull candy, they have a good bass but the quality of the earphones is not so good, many people including me have faced a problem where one of the earplugs stopped working within 6 months. Coming to jbl and Sony , though these are reputed brands I just feel their products are overpriced. Senheisser being a reputed brand too, has delivered a best in class product here, with a killer pricing of under 899INR. I actually bought them for 699. You can get them at lower prices during any sale.**The only thing I felt missing in these earphones is a mic. Yes, if you are looking for earphones that allow taking calls, this is not the one for you.**Judgement: If you are looking for best in class earphones under 1.5k, without a mic and provided you are not a die hard fan of jbl or Sony , just go with these earphones blindfolded.

tilte: One of the best earphones out there in this price bracket
review_body: I normally don't write reviews but this particular product made me behave otherwise. I've had them for 14 months now and i must say that this pair, given the price at which they come, is one of the best (if not the best) pair of headphones currently being offered with great sound and exceptional durability (which is quite amazing considering their flimsy build). They are not bass heavy, and give off an all-round rich sound with superb clarity. I find them to be way better than the JBL C100SI. Ever since my purchase, I've used them almost daily for 5-6 hours and haven't spotted a problem (yet). They've been tugged, stretched and bent in every way possible and they still survive, miraculously, to this day. If you're looking for great sound quality and are willing to compromise on seemingly weak built quality, then, without a doubt, go for them.

I bought this earphone on 13 Dec 2017 and have been using it until now. After two years the earphones finally started showing some problems for the first time after two years. I knew this kind of problem is gonna happen some time when I bought this because no product is ever lasting. But I am genuinely surprised to have this working for the past two years without any issues because I am particularly not too gentle with the earphones. Can't the say the sound quality that you get is the absolute best but can definitely say its the absolute best for the price that you pay. The product has been part of my life for the last two years, I feel bad for replacing it now. The only con that I have faced is the absence of a mic, but I got used to that eventually. If you are with a budget of Rs 800 and in a dilemma to choose which earphone, just blindly go for this. You can't go wrong with this one.

tilte: One of the best earphone in wired catagory
review_body: I have tried various earphones like Mi, WeCool, Bolt, Boat and even JBL but Senisser is the best and no match to it. Even though its a wired earphone its quality is on par with the other wireless brands.I recommend this earphone for anyone who enjoys music more than high unnecessary bass !Sound - 5/5Noise cancellation - 4/5Quality (Low frequency) - 5/5 Quality (Medium frequency) - 5/5Quality (High frequency) - 5/5

Great product from Sennheiser at Rs 800/-. These earphones are very light, ergonomic and fashionable. Their cable is very thin but strong enough to resist normal wear and tear easily. The build quality is decent. Overall, the durability is good at the price tag they come with.Coming to how these sound, perhaps these are the loudest earphones under 1k. They have a high sensitivity of 110db/mw which is higher than any earphone at this price. These pack some tight and punchy bass (mostly upper and musical bass). Sub bass is not promising but you cannot expect an earphone to have everything at this price. Mids are present and at par with what any other earphone has to offer under 1k. Vocals sound very natural and boasts of a great deal of clarity. The highs are very sparkling and crisp but however at loud volumes, they can get a little soaring and distorted (usually after 90% volume). At higher volumes, the lows are dominated by highs which is necessary to ensure they sound detailed and clear. Overall they have a good close to the original sound reproduction except the distortion at high volumes. Bass is not very heavy. Sound is very rich, detailed and crisp.These earphones are good for those who want to enjoy listening to a variety of genres due to a well balanced sound. But more balanced is the sound, lesser the fun it becomes to listen to any specific genre. They also have a good SOUNDSTAGE which is not too narrow but not so wide as well. Stereo sound is average. You can hear the different instruments somewhat distinctively.

There's a lot of hype around Sennheiser products, and rightly so, but considering the price, one could easily find equivalents in other brands at a much lesser price (eg- Boat, JBL). That being said, this is one of the best earphones I've used. Sound Quality is one near flawless with a very good balance between Bass and Treble. Good choice for people who like to appreciate the subtlety in music. Not a good choice for Bass lovers.Sound Quality - 5starBuild Quality - 4star. The wires are very thin and feel fragile, the only con of this earphone. But they provide a pouch with it. Not for rough use.Noice Cancellation - 5starMicrophone - 5star. One of the best I've ever encountered.

The product in itself has no flaw as such but it's me who isn't the right customer for these pair of earphones, as all I've been listening on, all these years, were Extra Bass ones from Sony.Someone similar to my taste can clearly tell the difference as the bass is lacking compared to the Sony s and I found the highs to be a little bit too overpowering, resulting in a shrill kinda output at max volumes (cause that's how I prefer listening to my music).Sound clarity is more than decent as well.Build quality could have been better but I won't complain much as the price is really suitable and the warranty period is 2 years and they are known for exchanging the whole pair with a new one, if any problem is faced within the warranty period.(source : my friends have been using these for years and they have got a few new pairs trading in the old ones for free) After sales service has to be commended.If you can get the size of the ear tips correct (for me : it's always the largest ones), this pair can be good at blocking outside noise while you're in noisy environments.For average people, this is a good overall package as one might not like blasting their music at full volumes all the time and everyone's not bass friendly.All in all, a thumbs up, if you're not ME type of a person.

tilte: Excellent option at a very reasonable price
review_body: I received my earphones today and although this review might be a little preemptive, I felt it was necessary to put in a word to address some concerns that potential buyers might have. One of the first concerns I had was if the product was fake; because a few other reviewers pointed to the same. As soon as I received the package, I went to the Sennheiser website to make sure that my product was genuine. It was, indeed. My primary concern allayed, I opened the package and I was very happy with everything. You get a 3.5mm adapter, extra ear buds, a pouch, and a manual. The earphones themselves are just fantastic, I tested them quite rigorously today and they held up very well. The bass is not extraordinary, but it's very good quite frankly speaking and unless you're an obsessive audiophile, you shouldn't be disappointed with the sound. The build quality is good, they don't feel cheap. I played a range of music, from your Bollywood numbers to trance to hip-hop to death metal to Djent even and found that the sound was quite good and enjoyable. At decent volumes, these earphones shut the world out and immerse you in the music completely. At the price, these earphones are a steal. I'll continue to use these and revise my review if they ever fall short of expectations.

Noise cancellation is impressive too.2) Clarity on calls is superb, using it daily for calls on both laptop and phone.3) The build looks robust, especially the mic which broke for my 3 earlier earphones. I am a person who commute most days, 6 hours up and down in train. So music of all geners and movies from around the world occupy most of my journey time, all these years. So to listen to music and watch movies without fatigue and noise of the train is very much important for me. To put in short, this ear phone is neutral. Sound quality of this ear phone is  very good. Those who love neutral sound (which is the best option to listen to all types of music), can very well opt for this. Sound equilibrium from high freequency to low without distortions is well maintained. (I can give u a tip to check your audio listening devices. Play "Bohemian Rhapsody by queen. The song covers all most all freequency levels, with different vocals and instruments.)  No sickening high bass. Those who love thumping bass may opt for other ear phones.But....... This product is not worth what it costs. The same quality of Sound can be obtained from a JBL  C100SI earphone as well (Durabilty of the mentioned JBL product is below average. I couldnt even use it for one year)  but it costs only half the price of this  product. I cant say anything about durability at this moment, since i bought this just one day back only.Hoping for the best...

And it is finally at my door, that day I didn't know that I'm holding a little monster that's gonna blow me away. I usually love to hear 20hz~40hz bass at max, and curve down to 15khz. Pump bass and treble at 8:2 ratio. I use "POWERAMP" music player to listen my marijuana. 4th month of usage.

tilte: They are not taking the comfort fit branding lightly
review_body: These are the most comfortable and light earphones I have ever used and trust me I have used a lot including sony mdr , audio technica , boats , ant audio etc. These are so comfortable that I forget I have them in my ears when nothing is playing .The sound quality is adequate at this price point with more focus on the highs , but you can use an equaliser to get base if you like that . The instrument seperation is better than average.The build seems rather flimsy but they come with 2 years warranty.

Hearing any songs on CX275 were outstanding whereas CX100 its an usual sound produced by the earphones which comes with a new smartphone. Its not worth it guys if you have cash for buying CX275 go for it you won't regret but even if you don't have the money and if you are not in a hurry to buy a earphones save some extra money and buy CX275, its truly worth every penny you spend. The headphone is really good considering other headphones of this price range. One more thing I would like to mention that replacement policy is very good of Sennheiser. When I contacted the customer care they assured me that considering the covid-19 situation they have extended the warranty period. I couriered my headphone along with invoice bill and they have replaced it with a new one. Only good brand can provide this type of customer care service. I will always go for Sennheiser over Sony or JBL.

I'm pretty surprised that this earphone has got the highest rating plus most number of overwhelming positive reviews among same category of products within this price range. Writing this review after I used it for more than 3 years. So consider reading the complete review.First the cons:1. Wire is a bit thin. But very smooth to handle.2. If not kept in a proper case, it'll take you few seconds to unwind.3. None other that I know of.Pro:1. Highly durable if you care enough for the things you use.2. The 2 years warranty is something. If you find the music is not as good as when it was new due to some issue in earbuds, return (courier or in person) it to the Sennheiser guys. Provided it is physically undamaged, they will hand you over a new one.3. Noise cancellation is optimum. Pedestrians must avoid using it if in heavy road traffic.4. Awesome music quality. You can actually distinguish between different frequencies and different instruments that has be used. Mid and high frequencies sounds crisp. Bass could have been better. Ofcourse you mustn't compare the quality with the ones you get with 3k-4k bucks.5. Use it for long hours, I mean really long time, still you won't find  anything uncomfortable with you ears. Can be used comfortably while you're sleeping in you bed.6. Though I don't have prior experience using any big company earphone products, I had bought it after researching all the products/reviews available online. Believe me I'll again go for this if I had to buy a new one. The best in this price segment.

Considering the price range this product comes in, it has a very good sound quality. The bass is ok compared to JBL C100 . This earphones are for people who enjoy listening to light music.The build of this earphone is good . If you are a person  who likes passive notice cancellation like me then go for it. It fits perfectly on your ears and you don't have to adjust it again and again. It's very comfortable.One thing I don't like about it is that " it tangles". But if you handle it appropriately it doesn't trouble you much.I like that it comes with 2 years warranty compared to other products in this price range.

This is probably my first ever review. My requirement was pretty straight forward and Sennheiser CX180 fits right into that.1. I already had 2 earphones but none of these have effective passive noise cancellation. I wanted to avoid the s***ty music being played in Gym so I bought these and I can say these are amazing and does the job at best even in a very loud and noisy backgroud of Gym.2. I really get annoyed of earpieces falling off the ear. I dont like over ear design because they are really uncomfortable if wore a long time over sweaty ears. Sennheiser CX 180 are very comfortable and sticks to you ear like a glue. I had no problem while jogging running or doing any other exercise.

The product is very durable, the first one which I have almost last for 3 years now I have gotten the 2nd one.Sound quality is also good, bass is a bit low and treble is on the higher side. I have 2 more sennheiser earphones which I have bought about 2 years back but they are still working, not same can be said about skullcandy and jbl earphone which stopped working inside 6 months time period. So if you are a rough user of earphones this is the best for you, but if you are a bass lover then go for other earphones

Best in class..! If you don't use mic much, then go for it.! Great music experience.! It's better than Mi earphones basic which costs around 400Rs and also better than Boat bassheads 225 which costs around 550Rs! If you are a little flexible with budget, then go for it.! You won't regret for the extra bucks you've paid.! Also it comes with a 2 year warranty, whereas other products in this segment offer only 1 year.! I got it for Rs750 in the lightning deal.!The noise cancellation is good.! The sound quality is great with good highs mids and lows.! The bass quality is decent..!

I have been using this for almost 6 months now and I'm having doubts that it might be a fake one. Better to buy these electronic products from showroom hereafter.Update: This is definitely FAKE. Never in my lifetime have I ever come across such a bad quality headphones. This just randomly stopped working just few hours ago for God knows what reason. I regret this buy.

I have been searching for a replacement to my Philips earphones for quite some time now. The Sennheiser CX 180 delivers a better sound and clear one as well. The wire is long enough and sturdy.My only bone of contention is the earplugs that are a bit uncomfortable, as compared to my Philips.

tilte: Bought one broke down, bought another broke down again.
review_body: This is a really good earphone that's why I bought again the same model from amazon because the first one broke down now agin a few days back another one again stopped giving output sound from one earphone same problem that happened earlier  with the first one.Now I am not going to buy the third one.It was a good journey of 2 year , now I am breaking up .Good bye.

Didn't even last 14 days. I was a bit suspicious about this product but I proceeded any way, thinking it was a Sennheiser product afterall. This is of so cheap quality, never buying Sennheiser again. About the problem:- Audio jack is causing problems, sometimes it's working and sometimes not. Plus it is causing abnormal behaviour in mobile.

This pair is my most favorite one among so many other branded earphones including B&O earphone that comes with my LG V 30 plus, AKG, Apple ear pod and many others. While B&O is equally good if you like clearty over balanced sound. While Senheissers 275 produces more balanced, more warm sound, excellent to wear, no pain in the ear which I prefer most. With my LG V30 B & O edition with hifi quad dac this one converts listening song a musical extravenga. Simply next level.

Superb sound, bass or treble all perfect, many people say that base is low but its not at all low. infact its perfect. and according to ones preferences, bass and treble can be adjusted with equilizer. 2 years warranty is more than worth buying these earphones.One Tip: Do confirm with the co. whether your product is original or not. First i had bought these thru Mukund TraderS and they sent me refhrbished one, displaying original. Thanks to Amazon, I got it returned with full refund, quickly.Then I reordered by this supplier and got original product. Overall i am happy as my problem was solved.

tilte: Name carries the legacy. Trust this brand.
review_body: Like: Sound Quality. Guys this product is worth buying. Noice Cancellation: Not in build. The ruber cups cancels the outside noise by blocking it. Bass Quality: Apt to the sound. Note: Sennheiser has been pioneered in this and no doubt, their product will fail to the likes of an individual.

tilte: Sennheiser CX 180 Street II In-Ear Headphones
review_body: The sound quality is excellent for this price range. The M size earbuds for snugly so it's more of a passive noise cancellation. I'm worried about the durability of the thin wires. Only time will tell. I take extra precaution while handling these.

I purchased both Cx 180 and Cx 275s. After few months of use earbuds quality of Cx 180 is still same while Cx 275s hardly fits in my ear now. Cx 180 has more bass and good audio output whereas Cx 275s sounds more of treble and overall experience music quality is degraded .

I bought two sennheiser cx 180 headphones. One stopped working after 2 months of use and another stopped working after 9 months of use.. (Voice is not comming from one side) Sound quality is good... In the warranty information there is 2 yr's of manufacturing warranty and it is mentioned that u have to keep sku package for warranty claim. But i don't have sku package... I think amazon is selling duplicate product...

tilte: excellent headset, delivery could have been quicker though
review_body: got this in a lightning deal, the best i could get the price. Review after for 3 days of usePros:Sound quality is awesome, thumping bass and crisp treblesgot 3 pairs of ear buds (one connected, 2 separately provided in the package)superior ambient noise attenuationvery light, can't feel a thing in ears other than the sound coming out of the headset's diaphragmscame with a carry pouch & an additional connectorworking fine with Samsung & Lenovo android mobiles as well as laptop with windows 10Nicely packed by amazon/sellerCons:Wire is thin and gets tangledin-line mike has limited functionality remote (can't complaint much for the price tag)took 10 days to deliver, had issues with courier service, 1 star less for that

Headphone is good. Sound quality good, not the best. But left side earphone stopped working after 5 months. There is no reason of physical injury as I have placed it with every care. It stopped automatically. Mediocre headphone. My other headphones lasted longer than this product.

This is my 2nd cx275s (first time I got from reliance ), I was happy when I got the product , but I had a little doubt on that it is original or not (because the qr code didn't hade any code number as shown in othe review videos) and  also because when I saw old review videos on youtube the bill sticker was on the back side , but now it's on the side , but after seeing the wire quality and the sound quality I believe it's original. Even after that I tried contacting Sennheiser to confirm the authentication , I dint get any reply , wait for Sennheisers reply

Its very amazing I have been using it since 3 months and its sound is crystal clearDisclaimer: it's not for bass lovers .... I listen to music very much and I am fine with its simple bassI would recommend to those who study online or who watch movies too much it's best earphone ... Sound quality crystal clear .Now on durability I can't say as I never broke any earphone before nor this time . So I can't say it depends person to person.Someone people says in comments that its not durable ... But I don't think so ( my opinion) .

tilte: Very good earphone but needs some equalizing in the frequencies to sound clean.
review_body: This headphone is very good but there's one point that the headphone comes with a very bad EQ. The mids are acquiring too much of the sound so it sounds really muddy and though the bass is good is doesn't sounds clean. But there's a good news that after EQing it nicely on my phone and Lappy , like boosting the high frequencies and low ones and drastically lowering the mids , it really sounds so cleand and beautiful. I love it after that.Also I think JBL is good in this aspect becui their sound is far better equalized but the bass is less ofcourse.

Have to say I am satisfied with this product. I wouldn't go as far as saying that they are extraordinary or special but they are worth the price.The first thing I noticed was that the Bass was quite lacking with this. Bass hogs will be very disappointed. However the sound quality and the little elements of any track are very nicely sounded out with these earphones.I'd say these earphones are good for people who want to listen to the music in its original or pure sense or how the producer intended it to be. In other words better for softer music. This isn't really great for people who like blasting out their tracks.Aesthetically the earphones are pleasing to the eye although they get entangled quite a lot. Fits well within the ear and is quite comfortable.Overall 4 stars. Minus one is for the lack of bass, entanglement and doing just enough.

tilte: Pathetic build quality... poor 2 months use experience
review_body: Review 1: Sound quality is good. Bass is adequate not much not less. But the microphone is not there.. I thought it would not be the major issue but I guess it is.. please have a headphone with mic trust me...Review 2: after 2 months usage the wire started breaking and one piece is not working now. Can I change it in warranty?Review 3 : after 3 months the wire broke into pieces.. that too in lockdown when I'm at home only and no wear and tear due to handling in pockets and other things.. don't buy guys...

Just Go For It!If u want sound quality and believe in brand.Senheiser is the brand used by profession and why u will feel by using this headset.Buy it during sale for extra discounts.You won't get mic for phone calls, for me it was not a issue as I dont use much calling.

I purchased this last week. Good delivery by Amazon, got it on second day.I've been trying different earphones of philips, sony, skullcandy and even steel series siberia v1(though it's built for gaming not for music) for long time to get the best earphone in my budget and now I tried this. I haven't experienced anything like this before. Excellent bass with crystal clear sound even at 10% volume and complete isolation from noise. If your phone doesn't support some of these earphones, no worries. A connector comes with the earphone for your phone.If you wanna have a new experience, try this...

tilte: The only decent option in this price range.
review_body: 1. Bass is good, doesn't disturb the vocals.2. Highs are a little boosted which gives a bright sound.3. Comfortable to wear.4. Wires tangle a lot but cannot complain for this price range.5. Not an Audiophile thing but decent for regular use if you are fine with mediocre sound quality.

I own an over the ear fro SH it's not supposed to be good as it's cheap, so its still around, when I am just working and don't want to listen to music, this I thought should be better, based on in ear, but other than the ear cushion close isolation it creates, the music is even poorer than the over ear wired ones from SH. Not happy.

This is by far the best earphone I have ever used. I generally use the earphone on a bike and it tends to get stuck. And sometimes the wire gets stretched.But even after rough usage. it does not lose its quality. I used it for more than two years and it broke due to my negligence.Ordered the same again.A bit low on Bass but produces excellent high and lows.Must buy for a music lover.

Genuinely the best earphones under 1000 maybe even under 2000.  Wire quality might not be the best but it will surely last if u handle it well . Plus, u get 3 year replacement warranty by senheiser so that's a relief. As for music, it's really loud n clear with ample bass n treble. Dolby Atmos in my phone makes it sound even better. Actually, It's even better than my headphones. You can feel every beat

It did an in depth research for a week, and finalised with cx 180, i checked it for two days and the sound quality was really good but not that much base,i returned it and ordered cx 275 s(double the price of cx 180) but the sound quality is ofcourse better with a good base too + 2 years warranty gives complacency. trust me guys the more you will research,the more you will get confused ...Sennheiser is a good brand name, sound quality is also good plus the waranty and servicing part is also amazing.Befor these earphones i was using sennheiser Hd 202 but after 3 years they got broken due to my fault.So the conclusion is :-Dont think much, go for cx 275 , if you are a music lover (audiophile) and agr costly lage to ye socho 1600 pay karne k bd k 2 saal ki warranty hai,atleast 800 rs each year to afford ho skte h, ye sochke le dalo..brand value and amaazing sound quality with great bass and mic , aur kya chiye

tilte: sound is awesome clear , clear bass,clear vocal , but build quality is like cheaper.
review_body: i used boat ,jbl,1more,mibasic ,also sound magic, and house of marly , all are around 500 to 1500 price segment,in sound and clarity also base and vocal ,mic clarity, best one is this product cx 275 is best ever in this price with mic,CON: ONE BUILD QUALITY SEEMS LIKE LOCAL CHEAPER EARPHONE ABOUT 200 TO 300 RS AROUNDCON: TWO 3.5 MM JACK IS NOT 90 DEGREE L SHAPED, IT IS STRAIT SO IT POSSIBLE TO DAMAGE JACK IN POCKET.OTHER WISE BEST SOUND IN THIS PRICE SEGMENT EVER I HEARD ACROSS ALL BRAND I MENTION ABOVE.I PREFER TO BUY BUT IF POSSIBLE USE 90 DEGREE L-SHAPE 3.5MM JACK ADAPTER AND USE WITH CARE

i was wondering and surfing for the best earphone on amazon and suddenly got the name Sennheiser , literally the earphones have a good quality of sound that can beat most of the wired earphones like same feature. i will highly recommend this product to buy.only due to rubber holder in ear doesnt allow you at all to hear any outer sound, so make sure you will not wear it while driving, cycling/.

tilte: Average earphones with poor build quality , go for realme buds 2
review_body: overrated product . i bought realme buds 2 and saw so many good reviews of cx180 , so i decided to buy it and used it.  The sound is clear , but bass comes when necessary but realme buds 2 have better overall sound , bass , build quality with mic and volume control buttons + braided cables . and lookwise realme buds 2 are better.  Sennheiser has every thin wires but only plus is 2years warranty unlike 6months in realme buds 2 .honestly , buy realme buds 2 , they wont disappoint.  if you are hardcore Sennheiser fan then these are good.

tilte: Great sound but a delicate piece, pin stopped working.
review_body: I have no issues with Amazon delivery, it's seamless as expected.Product is great too but it's too delicate.The pluggable Pin is damaged in 6 months. When I connect it to a device and play music, it plays in only one of ears, and, when I try adjusting the pin while connected the device, it flickers and starts playing in both ears and any movement of either ear phone pin or the device, it again stops playing in one of the ears.I have not yet taken to Sennheiser service centre as their working hours are only on week days so it makes very difficult to  get it done.Over all, these ear phones give best sound but too delicate to use outdoor on daily basis.

These headphones are not for bass lovers. These are for those who prefers clear sound. Go for JBL or Boat if you want bass.If you want clear voice go for it.They are very small and it makes them very comfortable. You can lie down sideways even with these in your ears.

Best in class earphone which u can get for such a cheap and throwaway price.I have purchased this earphone after trying sony wi c200 (wireless ) and must say the quality is far better , although credit can be given since it is a wired earphoneSuitable for rough usage , it has been over a 3 months , i have been using it roughly( as if sleeping with the earphone on , accidental pull on earphone) and still is working fineThe wire are tangle free ie they dont get entangled in each other which is the best part i found about this productoverall a great product in this range and a total value for money!!

Best earphones I had till date. Best sound. Noise cancellation is superb. And it fits well in ears. Only issue is not the tangle free cable. But that doesn't create lot of problem. I am using it in both mobile and laptop. Found it to be clear in both.

These are just AMAZING!!! I must say that these are the best ones I've come across and yes Better than skullcandy JBL or even Sony or its own successor Cx 213!(too loud)Loudness - 5/5 (PERFECT LOUDNESS).Clarity - 5/5 (Vocals and sound effects are like a theater)Bass - 4/5 (Crisp clean bass but not too overpowering)Noise cancelling - 5/5 (Noise cancellation is awesome)They have a great build quality and come with two year warranty!! So if you are looking for a earphone that doesn't make the sound artificial and makes everything better these are my pick at this price range.Device used : Vibe X3 (Dolby Atmos) THIS IS THE PERFECT COMBINATION.

I bought two earphones one with mic one with out mic on 27march19 , it's not even 2 months properly the left earphone doesn't work for one The other one is not working properly either ,  There is a loose connection with the wiring , one doesn't work at all all the other I have to keep adjusting the wire it's so annoying .never expected this from a brand like Sennheiser , very disappointed

tilte: Just Ok, nothing to be amazed with.
review_body: For the price, this is a bit disappointing item. Better go with JBLs. I was earlier using JBLs and liked it much more than there.

tilte: Good Balanced Sound. Poor Build Quality.
review_body: Sound quality is good. Sound is well balanced. If you want extra punchy bass, these are not for you. Sennheiser now has poor build quality, the earphones last only one year. Keep getting it replaced every 1 year. If you have rough tough use these are not for you. Also Sennheiser only has 4 service centres in country, you better be around one of them if you want to buy Sennheiser.

tilte: (gets u killed by enemy coming from right side) right earbud not working
review_body: the product is good and shows the sound quality of Sennheiser but for me and for few others, u can see in the review,  the right side bud had stooped working after one month of use, i am 100% sure the product was not rough handled or used in any way which could damage the product, i had used the product during my quarantine period so pretty much i had it connected to my laptop on my desk, i have request for a replacement, if i have a positive replay i will update this reviews.

tilte: The best ear phones for under INR 1500
review_body: Buying it for the second time after the first one stopped working after three long years of using. This one is the best earphones. The sound quality and fidelity is simply top notch. Boat rocker feels so menial and lame compared to this.

Excellent earphones. I bought this product in 2014 - August. Writing this review after 4years. Still they are working great. Excellent sound quality with great bass. Even low instrument sounds can be heard clearly through this. Coming to material quality, I can say it as top notch product. The wire got only a little cut after 4years of rough usage which explains it's durability. Awesome earphones. I got it for ‚Çπ500 after discount. tilte: Not up to my expectation, over-hyped
review_body: Its not at all comfortable to the ear in-spite of trying the three different bud sizes. Sound quality average and a little too sharp, JBL is better for me as I use it for non-music throughout the day due to work related.  This earphone hurt my ears even within an hour's use. Returning is too late so I am stuck with it.

Just awesome. Used a soundmagic es18s before this, that was good too. But this one is so much better than that. Incredible noise cancellation, awesome audio quality. Crisp and sharp. I just wish the wire quality was better.Edit: Six months into this earphone, and the left earpiece has already stopped working.

It has been more than 3 years since I bought this headphone. Iam completely satisfied with it. But one side of the headphone has stopped working now and Iam thinking of buying a new one. I have been contemplating for a while but could not think of any other product than this one. If Iam going to buy a new one, it will be the same model. For any headphone, 3 years is a good span and Iam sure that if we protect the portion near the plug from being worn out, it will definitely last much longer. Usually in any headphone , one side of it stops working because the wire near the plug portions gets worn out with time.

tilte: Best Earphones You Can Ever Get!
review_body: Yesterday my phone fell. Guess who saved it? My earphones with wires. Yes. Wires. üòÇPeople these days have been going for True Wireless. But one question has been bugging me ever since I saw them. What if one of them falls and you lose it?These earphones won't ever let that happen. They don't get Tangled. You'll love it!The best Bass you'll ever get. Best Noise Cancellation. Microphone works just perfectly.There's no cons about these earphones. I'm buying this for the second time.The best part is the pouch you get along with them.If you want to buy good quality earphones and are willing to spend 2-3k on them, rather spend on these.

Astronomical value for money. These earphones reproduce the old hifi standards without overshoots on bass and treble. It faithfully reproduces natural sound. The voice comes through very well . Bass is not overaching to the ear as is seen in most speaker systems of today. Treble is deep and pleasing to hear. Voice comes through well balanced. Overall at this price it is a marvel . Can easily rival many earphones costing many times over. Buy without hesitation.

Today one earphone stopped working so I am putting this reviewJust now my earphones got stuck in bus seat and pulled off.Now m planning to buys new headphones....IL go for Sennheiser only.

tilte: Left Earphone has low volume after just 6 months

tilte: A once good earphone fallen from grace
review_body: This is my third pair of these earphones in the last five years. The first two pairs were exceptional for their price and it showed, as their popularity and ratings on Amazon skyrocketed. The last pair I bought are awful and sound cheap and tinny. The bass is dull and treble too shrill. I suspect that as demand increased, Sennheiser cut quality or used cheaper parts, because they are definitely not as good as they used to be.

tilte: Awesome Earphone base is a bit boosted.
review_body: Was using E10C for last 2yrs. I liked the sound signature of the E10C more. Base felt a bit boosted. Sound clarity is no doubt awesome but a prefer flat sound signature rather than boosted base. If you prefer more balanced sound, go for E10C.

Compared to Rs 600 Mi ear phones, it performs slightly better in terms of less distortion at the high volume, a more punchy bass , noise cancellation is just ok, otherwise it doesn't justify a nearly 3x price when compared to the mi earphone.

No mic but the sound quality is awesomeBass is NiceTribal is niceVocal is NiceOver all sound quality is 9.5/10Fit is very important on earphones as it is very comfortable earphones than Boat Basshead 225.More lite weight i ever seen it only of 5 grams.The company gives 2 year of warranty which is again awesome .The cons areNo miceWire quality

tilte: Critical review after 1.7 year ( a true guide and comparison)
review_body: (nov,2018)If you prefer bass sound more than surely go for it.all over better than any other in its segment like sony and mi etc.more tone of trable is notified.Edited: (11sept, 2020)Build: lasted almost 1.2 year, then one stopped. Both stopped at 1.8 year.But i had used roughly in start for 6 months otherwise it would have lasted more properly. Thin wires are there, but externally looks delicate inside it's as strong as realme,jbl and sony.Sound quality: tried jbl c100si, boat basshead 225 and sony mdras210, and sony ex155ap,150ap. But compared to all these, Sennheiser sounded too better in balanced sound output. (Bass quality) Base is there, but bass is different thing as it has 20 hz lowest frequency not for typical bass lovers. But sony muffles the base and bass often with vocals and mids, these performes better.CONS: AT 100 percent volume as it is for balanced sound it happened to throw more treble which no-one will like. But if u have equilizer in your device then not at all to worry (i dnt have that's why it caused problem). But must to mention that it doesn't distort still at full volume.At lowest volume even the performance is heavenly. Every boat that i tried happened to throw so much irritating bass even in vocals and happened to change every music instrument sound because of too bass focused. So dnt buy boat at all. ( But if you don't knw and understand sound signature and cannot differentiate between good and bad then buy boat , because boat has 4.3 rating which is given by typical Indian music lovers who doesn't understand the quality and what is bass. They just want cheap bass)If your budget is high for 1500 i suggest to try sony xb55 or xb55ap because it has bass with balanced sound.Price: i bought this at 550 so it's too worthy believe me. Don't even buy 1000 rupees handset it's better than all except xb55 sony.Now i purchased it again today at 729. This model is stopped by company and has launched cx213 which is available at flipkart. (Don't buy tht, because in build quality cx180 is better)Amazon should not hype price of model which is not manufactured by company any more, only because it's only available here. But still this price is worthy to givr for cx180.One thing to remember it doesn't have mic, but still i re purchased it only because without mic handset is durable than with mic handset. If mic is necessary than go for another Sennheiser handsfree , otherwise it's good.So take care of what u need.Comfort: it's too comfortable. U will forget it is anything there in ears. So it's best. It has L shaped jack which is nice compared to other competitors. (L shaped jack is muct in today's time). Also it doesn't have angled eartip so if by accident u strech it, it will not break and will just fall from ears, so it's one of the pros.Before coming to comparison one important thing is it has 2 years warranty better, but anyway as u can see in my latest images rupper coating of joint and downside the earbuds teared off in one year only and they don't claim warranty for physically damaged piece. But if u care properly then ok. But not at all this rupper coating will last for 2 years (in dream , no matter how u care). But i must mention if your handset is not damaged physically I ve heard that after sale service is excellent as u would expect from premium brand. But not buy only because it has two year warranty it's of no use.Along with that no matter which wired handset u buy of 500 or 2000. It will last maximum 1.5 or 1 year, be it sony or boat. In rare cases I've seen some lasting for 2 years and even more.Comparison:Boat basshead 225: i returned that just before the day after trying it, too much bass. Doesn't deliver quality sound at all. Only typical bass lovers of india may like this irritating bass. (Similar to ubon handsfree of 150 rupees)Jbl c100si: I've listened songs in that so many times. It's better in bass compared to cx180. But cannot produce premium balanced sound. But it has mic so one plus point. Mine lasted for 1.2 years.They don't reveal driver size or frequency, so i don't like it.Sony ex155/ex150:Better in bass, but can handle mids and vocals better than jbl c100si.good byt price is over hyped wait for sale.Realmebuds 2:I had purchased when my right earbud stopped working but returned at the same time. Build quality impressive but anyway major downside like jbl , doesn't have L shaped jack. Even not gold plated. Otherwise overall good. For mixture of everything  mids , vocals and highs. It sounded well than what i had expected.Overall ratings : out of 10Build:Cx180- 8Jbl c100si and other models- 8.5Boat basshead 225/220 (both are same don't confuse): 9Sony ex155/150: 7.5Realme: 9.5(Don't know reality tasted review)Sound:Cx180- 9.5C100si jbl-8.5Sony ex155/150-9Realme-8.3Boat basshead 225-6After sale service:Jbl-8Boat-8Sony-9Realme-8Sennheiser:9.5Surround sound output:Jbl:8Sony:9.5Cx180:9Boat:5 (played pubg to notice surround by listening to foot steps of enemy , when enemy came in front me till then i could not decide from where ge is coming-lol)Sort guide:For bass jbl c100si or ex155. If budget is 1500 must buy xb55 sony (wait for sale , don't buy for 2000 not tht much worthy)For balanced sound but cx180 only. If mic is needed then go for jbl and then sony.Overall performance and features wise realme buds2 is better. As it has mic  but not so premium sound.If mic and too heavy bass is not priority then cx180 is the best as conclusion.

I would not recommend it. Please save your money guys. The bass is also not good. Its average but if you are a bass lover then dont go for it. I would say that the noise cancellation was verry good but the left one is not working right now.

It is great if you are a bass head  since it provide a very good bass without compromising with the clarity (even at full bass u can understand the vocals clearly ) . I have seen most of them had given the bad reviews about the quality of the wire , Yeah it's not that tough but they are pretty strong only you have to little caring not much though .It's my second earphone ,previous one lasts for more than 20 months even after being used badly.In shortSound Clarity :- 4/5 (even at such low cost ).Bass :- 4/5Fitting :- perfect buds and size get sticks to the ear easliy.Due to perfect fitting most of the outside noise gets isolated , even in the trains you hear noise barely.Wire quality :-3.5/5L shape connector (Strong)2yrs warranty but service centers are limited .

If you want to experience primum in mid range here is the option, I am reviewing it after 1 year of buying now it has been torn apart by my cat that's the different caseüòÖ,but I still miss it's sound quality it just has one down side it doesn't have mic, if just music or movies is your requirement this one I can recommend as a more than 1 year or experience guy...

tilte: Looking for good quality earphones with deep bass under 1000 RS.? well then sennheiser cx-180 is for you!
review_body: This is the best earphone I have bought under 1000 RS..I needed an earphone which will give me good sound clarity,great bass and balanced lows mids and highs under 1000 RS. and these earphones do just that!!!When I first plugged these earphones,I was very excited to check out the sound quality of these earphones and they didn't disappointed me at all.Sound clarity was amazing,Bass was natural and deep,lows,mids and high were also well balanced.Quality of wire used in these earphones is also good.Earphone jack is gold plated.You get three pairs of earbuds of different size(small,medium and large).Earbuds are soft and comfortable.You can listen to music for really long time...they won't hurt your ears.So if you are looking for good quality earphones with deep and enhanced bass under 1000 RS. then Sennheiser CX-180 is for you.

tilte: Best headphone under 2k,no doubt about that.
review_body: I have a collection of various headphones, but must say that this is ths the best headphone atleast in sub 2k price range.I regularly listen music in my Moto G 1st gen, and I am quite serious about audio quality of the phone and the headsets. I, may not be an audiophile but can assure that this excellent headphone have the most balanced, precise audio output capabilities.Headsets I have used-1) sony mdr ex 30 - too bass heavy, audio not clear, bulky2) Creative ep630 - less bass, short wire, less warm sound3) Nokia wh205 - very good audio output, slightly bassy, not crystal clear sound as sennheiser, wire don't tangles.4) Cowon em1 - at par with Nokia wh205. Slightly midtone heavy5) soundmagic es18s - just bought  cannot beat sennheiser, but 2nd best, good balance, not very loud, good cable, but gets tangled.6) sennheiser cx 275-Pros- good balance between bass and treble, lows are clear and crisp, quite loud, very comfortable, excellent noise isolation, nice bagCons- slightly excess treble, mids not perfect, wires get tangled, cables are thin.There is hardly any headphone without any limitations, still I must say that this item satisfied my needs more than enough. I will purchase another one.

tilte: The best headset one can buy below 1000 INR price range
review_body: Before I say anything about this product, I would like to appreciate the service of amazon. At first, I was little unsettled with the expected delivery dates, because it was about 8 days. Then I consoled myself by thinking that I live in a rural area. Anyway, my product reached 3-4 days before the expected date, made me excited. May be that's how they execute their business strategy, but that's way better than the delayed deliveries, I would say.  The Sennheiser cx 180 street II is simply awesome. Last time I ordered skullcandy headsets, but that was not my kind of thing. The treble sound gave me headache, but though it worked really good for some of my friends. This one, as other satisfied customers explained, goes well with bass. Fits really well to my ears because of it's ergonomical design. The best headset one can buy within an affordable price range. Worth of money, worth of waiting. Thanks Sennheiser and yeah Amazon ppl..

tilte: Serious bass response with a light, secure design
review_body: The Sennheiser CX 275s is an earphone pair geared towards the bass lover on a modest budget. At Rs. 1690, it's neither cheap nor over-priced, and offers solid, distortion-free audio performance. The boosted lows will scare away purists, and even bass fiends might find the highs, which are boosted and tweaked in peculiar spots, occasionally tinny or harsh. An inline remote control and microphone add value to the CX 275s, but the remote lacks volume controls, which is a bit of a bummer. Overall, the CX 275s is a powerful pair with a lot to love,Pros - Powerful, distortion-free audio performance with deep, boosted lows. Inline remote control and microphone for mobile devices. Comfortable, secure, lightweight fit.Cons - Inline remote has no volume controls.

tilte: Bang for the buck entry level earbuds! But..
review_body: Right after I unpacked these tiny little beat busters, I used them while working out in gym. That was my first hand experience I loved the way it handled my workout playlist which mainly contains heavy metal, electronic and rock music. I liked the noise isolation and the bass.I experimented them later with different music genres and came up with the conclusion that if you are just looking for something decent under a grand then these are for you. But nothing top of the charts though. Seriously!Edit-So it's been more than a year and half. The 3.5mm jack is not working anymore giving me weird noise chopping off certain bass notes entirely. Maybe it's because of my rough usage but I would have liked this one really well it it had lasted longer. And the cable had broken couple months ago.Highs  : 6/10Mids  : 5/10Lows  : 7.5/10Noise cancellation  : 7/10Overall clarity  : 7/10The best part- I bought it for Rs 598!

There's no thump, if that's what you seek, but i'm sure you'd be happy with how the bass sounds.. The noise cancellation is brilliant.. The cable length is ample, and the build quality feels strong..Close your eyes, and go for this product if you've been eyeing it.. :D No buyer's remorse here..Happy music tripping.. ;)
